Download Project Document : http://www.az.undp.org/content/dam/azerbaijan/docs/Governance/AZE_UNDP_Civil_Registry_Pro_Doc_2010.pdf
Project Name : Establishment and Development of State Register of Population of Azerbaijan, Phase III
Project starting date: July, 2006
Project ending data: August, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/democratic_governance/Establishment_and_Development_of_the_State_Register_of_Population_of_the_Republic_of_Azerbaijan.html
Brief description : Main goal of the project is to establish a single, reliable and comprehensive database on the population of Azerbaijan. The database will ease the registration of the civil status acts and issuance of certificates and national citizens documents.

Project Name : Good Governance through Civil Service Reform, Phase III
Project starting date: January 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.un-az.org/undp/sehife.php?lang=eng&page=020011
Brief description : The project aims at increasing the capacity of Civil Service Commission (CSC) under the President of Azerbaijan and civil servants from state institutions to implement the ethics, conduct rules and performance appraisal system. It has the following two objectives (i) to strengthen the capacity of the relevant staff of CSC, central and local government agencies, and (ii) to develop competence of civil servants at central and local level for the implementation of the performance appraisal system.

Project Name : Capasity Building Support to State Social Protection Fund extension of 5-th phase
Project starting date: November , 2003
Project ending data: December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/democratic_governance/Capacity_building_for_the_State_Social_Protection_Fund_of_the_Republic_of_Azerbaijan.html
Brief description : This is the extension the 5th phase of the project launched on September 1, 2008. The project aims at assisting the State Social Protection Fund of the Republic of Azerbaijan (SSPF) to introduce a new pension system based on individual accounts. UNDP support will be delivered on two major components of the reforms: (i) infrastructural development of the SSPF branch offices to ensure adequate functionality and service delivery; and (ii) roll-out of the management Information System to increase the efficiency of business processes and data processing capacity.

Project Name : Establishment of the Internet Governance Forum (IGF) Secretariat (7 th Internet Governance Forum 2012)
Project starting date: April 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.intgovforum.org/cms/component/content/article/114-preparatory-process/927-igf-2012
Brief description : The project aims at creating relevant local capacity to ensure successful implementation of Internet Governance Forum 2012 (IGF 2012) in Baku. In this light, the project will establish IGF Secretariat with relevant teams and coordination mechanisms for organization of this high-level event. The major project targets are 1) establishment of the IGF Secretariat with the relevant capacity to oversee all relevant organizational issues; 2) successful management of the IGF in Baku ensuring positive feedback from participants

Project Name : Further Strengthening and Expanding Mine Action Capacity in Azerbaijan
Project starting date: April, 2009
Project ending data: December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/crisis_prevention_and_recovery/Azerbaijan_Mine_Action_Programme.html
Brief description : The project aims at creating a national mine action capacity capable of planning, coordinating and managing all mine/ unexploded ordinance (UXO) related activities in the currently unoccupied areas, and enable it to expand into areas yet to be unoccupied. It will support ANAMA in upgrading its Mina Action and Resource and Training Center located in the Goygol region and it will enable ANAMA to construct additional facilities in Training Center and create possibilities to expand international training services offered by ANAMA

Download Project Document : http://www.az.undp.org/content/dam/azerbaijan/docs/Crisis%20Prevention/AZE_UNDP_Water_and_Flood_Pro_%20Doc_2012.pdf
Project Name : Integrating Climate Change Risks into Water and Flood Management by Vulnerable Mountainous Communities in the Greater Caucasus Region of Azerbaijan
Project starting date: March, 2012
Project ending data: March,2016
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/crisis_prevention_and_recovery/Water_Flood_Management.html
Brief description : The project aims to reduce vulnerability of the mountain communities of the Greater Caucasus region of Azerbaijan to climate change induced water stress and flood hazards by improved water and flood management. The three outcomes of the project are: 1) Water and flood management framework is modified to respond to adaptation needs and improve climate risk management 2) Key institutions have capacities, technical skills, tools and methods to apply advanced climate risk management practices for water stress and flood mitigation and 3) Community resilience to floods and water stress improved by introducing locally tailored climate risk management practices
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 2,350,825.00
Funding Partners: GEF ($ 2,350,825)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Emergency
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Baku
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Emergency
Contact person : Shamil Rzayev, National Programme Officer, office@un-az.org , tel: (+99412) 498 98 88, ext. 147
Country: Azerbaijan
Download Project Document : http://www.az.undp.org/content/dam/azerbaijan/docs/Crisis%20Prevention/AZE_UNDP_Water_and_Flood_Pro_%20Doc_2012.pdf
Project Name : Integrating Climate Change Risks into Water and Flood Management by Vulnerable Mountainous Communities in the Greater Caucasus Region of Azerbaijan
Project starting date: March, 2012
Project ending data: March,2016
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/crisis_prevention_and_recovery/Water_Flood_Management.html
Brief description : The project aims to reduce vulnerability of the mountain communities of the Greater Caucasus region of Azerbaijan to climate change induced water stress and flood hazards by improved water and flood management. The three outcomes of the project are: 1) Water and flood management framework is modified to respond to adaptation needs and improve climate risk management 2) Key institutions have capacities, technical skills, tools and methods to apply advanced climate risk management practices for water stress and flood mitigation and 3) Community resilience to floods and water stress improved by introducing locally tailored climate risk management practices
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 2,350,825.00
Funding Partners: GEF ($ 2,350,825)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Emergency
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Balakan
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Emergency
Contact person : Shamil Rzayev, National Programme Officer, office@un-az.org , tel: (+99412) 498 98 88, ext. 147
Country: Azerbaijan
Download Project Document : http://www.az.undp.org/content/dam/azerbaijan/docs/Crisis%20Prevention/AZE_UNDP_Water_and_Flood_Pro_%20Doc_2012.pdf

Project starting date: March, 2012
Project ending data: March,2016
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/crisis_prevention_and_recovery/Water_Flood_Management.html

Download Project Document : http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/sustain_development/solid-waste-management.html
Project Name : Solid Waste Management Improvement Project
Project starting date: Jun-09
Project ending data: July 2012
Visit project website: http://www.un-az.org/undp/sehife.php?lang=eng&page=021102
Brief description : The project aims at improving solid waste management by exploring multi-sector partnerships approaches. It will provide necessary training and capacity building support to the Ministry of Environment and Natural Resources(MENR), in order to enable this ministry to (i) formulate the necessary additional sector laws, regulations, norms and standards; (ii) develop RR strategy and initiate programs and regulations that will stimulate and enhance RR activities in Azerbaijan; (iii) carry out a field investigation and data collection program that will enable MENR to establish a SWM data bank; (iv) prepare planning guidelines for SWM facilities, and finally (v) to identify a suitable local demonstration project.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 900,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 350,000) Govt of Norway ($ 550,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources (MENR)
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Baku
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources (MENR)
Contact person : Chingiz Mammadov, National Programme Officer, office@un-az.org, tel: (+99412) 498 98 88, ext. 110
Country: Azerbaijan

Download Project Document : http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/sustain_development/renewable_energy.html
Project Name : Promoting Development of Sustainable Energy in Azerbaijan
Project starting date: January 2011
Project ending data: June 2013
Visit project website: http://greenazerbaijan.org/
Brief description : The project aims at promoting the development of sustainable energy in Azerbaijan. The specific objectives of the project are to: (i) support the building of one small hydro-power plant as a demonstration of its feasibility, (ii) capacity building, (iii) assess the potential for renewable power, (iv) identify which types of renewable power are economic or economic with minimal subsidy in each economic zone within the country; and (v) identify in a broad sense the geographic areas that offer good potential for placement of sustainable power generation.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 1,440,000.00
Funding Partners: EU ($ 650,000) Govt of Norway ($ 790,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Azerbaijan State Company on Alternative and Renewable Energy Sources (AREA)
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Baku
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Azerbaijan State Company on Alternative and Renewable Energy Sources (AREA)
Contact person : Chingiz Mammadov, National Programme Officer, office@un-az.org, tel: (+99412) 498 98 88, ext. 110
Country: Azerbaijan

Project Name : Project Preparation Grant (PPG) to improve the management effectiveness, including operational effectiveness and ecosystem representation of Azerbaijan?s Coastal and Marine Protected Area (CMPA) System
Project starting date: May, 2012
Project ending data: March 2013
Visit project website: n/a
Brief description : The Project Preparation Grant is being used by UNDP to prepare a Project Document for a Full-Size Project to be presented to GEF for financing. This will be done in close collaboration with the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resource (MENR). The existing legal and regulatory frameworks also will be assessed to identify specific areas where additional legislation will be required. This general framework then, will be looked in more details and applied in one of the selected Protected Areas, namely in the region covering the Qizila, State Nature Reserve, Kichik Qizila, State Nature Sanctuary and the proposed Qizila National Park
Thematic area : Environment and Energy

Project Name : Mobilizing Azerbaijani Youth for Action in Preparation for the Rio+20 Summit in 2012
Project starting date: November 1, 2011
Project ending data: October 31, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.un-az.org/undp/sehife.php?lang=eng&page=021103
Brief description : The project aims at supporting the Heydar Aliyev Foundation in starting up a national advocacy campaign mobilizing country's youth for action in the run-up to the global Rio+20 Summit. This project will have a three-fold objective: 1) engage youth in the environmental movement in the framework of the International Dialogue on Environmental Action initiative; 2) raise awareness of a broad range of stakeholders in Azerbaijan on the environment and development and the Rio process; 3) strengthen Azerbaijan's preparedness for Rio+20.

Project Name : Enabling Activities for the Preparation of Azerbaijan?s Third National Communication to UNFCCC
Project starting date: 2012
Project ending data: 2014
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/sustain_development/tnc.html
Brief description : Major Purpose of this project is to enable Azerbaijan to prepare and submit its Third National Communication in accordance with its commitments as a non-Annex 1 Party to the Convention. The project will also result in increased capacity to produce subsequent NCs that meet all guidelines established by the CoP and that can serve as a source of information for national and measures in climate change and in key economic and social sectors.

Project Name : Global Compact Local Network (GCLN) Azerbaijan and Support to Entrepreneurship Development
Project starting date: 2012
Project ending data: 2013
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/sustain_development/global-compact.html
Brief description : Project will continue promoting UNDP’s partnership for development with the business sector in Azerbaijan. The Project will undertake advocacy and awareness-raising events to promote the engagement of the private sector in UN/UNDP advocated development principles, notably the Millennium Development Goals and the Global Compact. The project will support the establishment of the Global Compact Local Network Azerbaijan within its period. The project will facilitate dialogue between business and other key development stakeholders in particular governments and civil society, in order to build trust and social capital, and stimulate and develop partnership activities. The Project will intend to attract key influencers about Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) at the local level, emerging economic and social issues such as the role and responsibility of private sector/businesses in society.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 124,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP: 124,000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Civil Society Organization (CSO) - The National Confederation of Entrepreneurs (Employers) Organizations of Azerbaijan Republic (AEC)
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Baku
Number of beneficiaries:

Country: Azerbaijan

Project Name : Support to Gender Research in Azerbaijan
Project starting date: 2011
Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.az.undp.org/content/azerbaijan/en/home/operations/projects/womens_empowerment/Support_to_Gender_Research_in_Azerbaijan.html
Brief description : The purpose of this project is to train a team of teachers and students of the State Pedagogical University who will then act as agents for change in traditional gender stereotypes and attitudes throughout the education system. The project will also support a research on abandoned women, wives of migrant workers, jointly with IOM, as this group of women remain neglected and there have not been any project in support of this group. The findings of the research will inform UNDP on the existing problems and can help in designing a project for this population group. Key words: gender, women empowerment, capacity building.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance

Project Name : Introducing the Stop TB Strategy in Belarus with a particular focus on taking measures to combat multidrug resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB)
Project starting date: 01 January, 2011
Project ending data: 31 December, 2015
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/00076939.html
Brief description : The project aims at providing access to the quality diagnosis of tuberculosis, creating enabling conditions at the national and local levels for improving the quality of response to MDR-TB and providing access to the treatment of drug resistant forms of tuberculosis, including at the facilities of the penal system as well as conducing empirical research into MDR-TB. Key words: Poverty reduction, tuberculosis, healthcare, treatment.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 26,198,804.00
Funding Partners: Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Healthcare of the Republic of Belarus
Number of project staff : 20
Name of the location (region/district, village): Minsk, Belarus
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : TB patients, TB facilities and prisons of the Republic of Belarus and Belarusian Red Cross Society
Contact person : UNDP Programme Officer:  Ms. Volha Kuzmianok Tel:   +375 (17) 327 48 76 e-mail: fo.blr@undp.org UNDP/GFATM Grants Implementation Unit in Belarus Tel: +375 (17) 200 06 46, +375 (17) 306 51 88 e-mail: giu@undp.org
Country: Belarus
Download Project Document : http://un.by/f/file/project-80237-en.pdf
Project Name : National Human Development Report: Sources of regional competitiveness in Belarus
Project starting date: October, 2011
Project ending data: January, 2013
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/80237.html
Brief description : The project is designed to assist the Government of Belarus in preparing the next National Human Development Report, which will be devoted to exploring the sources of regional competitiveness from the human development perspective. The project will facilitate the elaboration of the national concept of regional economies’ competitiveness, perform a comparative analysis of the socio-economic context in the regions, identify the regional economic and social “growth points”, and develop recommendations for enhancing the regional economies’ effectiveness and reducing the disparities in the quality of life in the regions of Belarus.The approaches and recommendations for the National Human Development Report will be widely discussed with the relevant stakeholders in the process of preparation. Key words: Poverty reduction, HDR, HDI, capacity building, research.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 125,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP, 125 000 USD with the possible additional provision of 31 000 USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Economic Research Institute of the Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Belarus
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Minsk, Belarus
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Belarus
Contact person : UNDP Programme Officer:  Ms. Julia Dzingailo    E-mail: fo.blr@undp.org Web-site: http://undp.by/ Tel:   (+375 17) 327 48 76; 327 81 49; 327 45 27 Fax: (+375 17) 226 03 40
Country: Belarus
Download Project Document : http://un.by/f/file/SRER-prodoc-eng.pdf
Project Name : Support to Socially Responsible Enterprise Restructuring in Belarus
Project starting date: July, 2011
Project ending data: June, 2013
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/00071903.html
Brief description : The focus of the project is on managing the social risks of enterprise restructuring and putting in place a socially responsible mechanism, and by implementing a set of preventive measures to contain unemployment and prevent the decline in living standards. The project will be piloted in two enterprises with modernisation and restructuring programmes that include personnel downsizing. The pilot will test the methodology for socially responsible enterprise restructuring and design a system for social contingency planning based on broad stakeholder participation. Key words: Poverty reduction, living standards, enterprices, modernisation.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 150,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP global programme “Responding to the Economic Crisis and Building Long-term Resilience”
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Belarus
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Minsk, Belarus
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : 1. Ministry of Labour and Social Protection 2. Ministry of Economy 3. Region/Oblast (City) Executive Committees (under the authority of which the pilot enterprises are) 4. Trade Union Federation; business associations; non-government organizations involved in promotion of local sustainable development

Project Name : Assisting the Government of the Republic of Belarus in Accession to the World Trade Organization through Strengthening National Institutional Capacity and Expertise
Project starting date: March, 2008
Project ending data: July, 2013
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/00057626.html
Brief description : The project’s main goal is to assist the Government of Belarus in WTO accession by strengthening national expertise and building institutional capacity to adjust national foreign trade policy as well as by raising public awareness of process and impact of WTO accession. Key words: WTO, poverty reduction, trade development.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 595,000.00
Funding Partners: The Government of the Russian Federation
Implementing partners (both central and local): The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Belarus
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Minsk, Belarus
Number of beneficiaries: 120

Project Name : Promoting Trade And Enhancing Export Capacity In Belarus
Project starting date: April, 2012
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/77203.html
Brief description : The project seeks to strengthen the national capacity to export and promote light industry products in international markets by utilizing best international marketing practices and information and communication technologies (ICTs). It is a part of UNDP’s Wider Europe project, financed by the government of Finland and covering Central Asia, South Caucasus and Western CIS. Key words: Poverty reduction, trade, export, capacity building, marketing process.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow

Country: Belarus
Download Project Document : http://un.by/f/file/00080822-ProDoc-Eng-_16Jan.doc
Project Name : Local Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
Project starting date: August, 2012
Project ending data: February, 2015
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/00080822.html
Brief description : The goal of Project is to strengthen the role of the private sector in the economies of Brest and Hrodna Regions and in the thriving tourism sector of the Republic of Belarus. The goal will be reached through the support of the development and growth of private micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) operating in the ecotourism sector, stimulating local initiative and job creation, and promotion and marketing of the project territories as tourist destinations both within the country, and beyond. Key words: Poverty reduction, private sector, private, job creation, gender.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 1,946,000.00
Funding Partners: USAID
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Sports and Tourism of the Republic of Belaru
Number of project staff : 8
Name of the location (region/district, village): Minsk, Belarus
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : 2 large initiatives will receive up to US$ 50,000; funding in the amount of up to US$ 15,000 will be provided to about 30 thematic initiatives of NGOs, business support centers, and other non-governmental entities active in eco-tourism

Project Name : Capacity Building of SALW Stockpile Management and Security
Project starting date: August, 2007
Project ending data: December, 2015
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/00054285.html
Brief description : The project aims to extend capacity of government in strategic planning and governance in the field of environment and environmental information. In particular, the project will suggest approximation of national biodiversity conservation legal framework, water management regulations, MSW management regulations and ecological certification of products to those of the EU to cover the gaps in the current legislation. The project will contribute additional efforts to raising awareness by general public about environmental concerns as well as public participation in environmentally-related decision-making processes through actual involvement of general public in playing a stakeholder role during implementation of several pilot projects. A local Aarhus center will be established in one of the oblasts selected for pilot projects implementation.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy

Project Name : Management of the Niemen River basin with account of adaptation to climate change
Project starting date: January, 2012
Project ending data: March, 2013 (the project could be prolonged)
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/79039.html
Brief description : The project aims to increase the capacity of the government in implementation of UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) through the sustainable management of water resources taking into account aspects of climate change impacts on Neman River basin. The assessment and forecast of water resources, taking into account the different climate change scenarios and trends of economic development for transboundary Neman River basin will be developed during the project. Recommendations for improvement of water management with account of adaptation to climate change activities will be developed as a practical result of the project for stakeholders. The project will also promote cross- border cooperation, including exchange of information and data between Belarus, Lithuania and Russia in the field of use of water resources. Key words: border management and cooperation
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 170,000.00
Funding Partners: Finland and Sweden via Environment and Security Initiative
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection of Belarus
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Niemen River basin
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of natural resources and environmental protection of the Republic of Belarus; Central Research Institute for Complex Use of Water Resources; Vilnius University, Lithuanian Environmental Protection Agency, Federal Agency of water resources of Russian Federation, Federal Service for hydrometeorology and environmental monitoring of the Kaliningrad region
Contact person : UNDP Programme Officer:  Igar Tchoulba E-mail: fo.blr@undp.org Web-site: http://undp.by/ Tel:   (+375 17) 327 48 76; 327 81 49; 327 45 27 Fax: (+375 17) 226 03 40
Country: Belarus
Download Project Document : http://undp.by/f/file/3985%20Project%20Document_28Sept09.pdf
Project Name : Mainstreaming Biodiversity Conservation into Territorial Planning Policies and Practices
Project starting date: January, 2010
Project ending data: January, 2014
Visit project website: http://undp.akvoapp.org/en/project/566/
Brief description : The project’s primary goal is to mainstream biodiversity conservation priorities into Belarusian territorial planning policies and practices. The project outcomes are: Development of the national institutional and expert capacity to integrate biodiversity concerns into the territorial planning in Belarus; Implementation of pilot activities on including biodiversity conservation requirements into territorial plans; Raising awareness of state agencies and the Belarusian population of the importance of biodiversity conservation for sustainable development. The project objective is to mainstream biodiversity conservation priorities into Belarus’ territorial planning policies and practices. The project will remove systemic, regulatory and knowledge barriers to mainstreaming biodiversity conservation into territorial planning.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 8,055,300.00
Funding Partners: GEF
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection
Number of project staff : 4
Name of the location (region/district, village): Minsk
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Rasony district Hlybokaje district Valožyn district Kareličy district Slonim district Ivacevičy district Babrujsk district Kličaū district Rahačoū district Rečyca district Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection of Belarus, Ministry of Forestry of Belarus, State Property Committee of Belarus
Contact person : UNDP Programme Officer: Igar Tchoulba E-mail: fo.blr@undp.org Web-site: http://undp.by/ Tel:   (+375 17) 327 48 76; 327 81 49; 327 45 27 Fax: (+375 17) 226 03 40
Country: Belarus
Download Project Document : http://un.by/pdf/Hum_Sec_prodoc_Eng_fin.pdf
Project Name : Enhancing Human Security in the Chernobyl Affected Areas of Belarus
Project starting date: May, 2010
Project ending data: April, 2013
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/00070564.html
Brief description : The project focuses on the following objectives (i) to enhance smallholders’ income security, (ii) to promote healthy lifestyles among pregnant women, new mothers and their families, (iii) to improve prevention, early diagnosis and treatment of breast cancer; (iv) to improve radiation safety knowledge and skills among children and young people; and (v) to reduce consumption of radioactively contaminated food. Key words: Crisis prevention, recovery, gender, women, income, poverty.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery

Total budget (USD): 1,613,053.00

Download Project Document : http://undp.by/f/file/Prodoc__HIV_Eng.doc
Project Name : Ensure Universal Access of the Key Affected Populations in Belarus to HIV Prevention, Treatment and Care
Project starting date: January, 2010
Project ending data: December, 2014
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/ca2c9681f525ddd7.html
Brief description : The overal goal of the project is to maintain the Republic of Belarus in the concentrated phase of HIV epidemics and decrease AIDS mortality. The goal is set in accordance with the international commitments of Belarus towards the MDGs and recommendations to scale up efforts toward the goal of universal access for HIV prevention, treatment, care, and support by 2010 and the national commitments set in the Universal Access Targets. This project focuses on expanding the coverage of the main vulnerable groups and gradual institutionalization of the prevention and treatment activities so that by the end of the grant the government in partnership with the civil society can take over most of the activities.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 27,847,214.00
Funding Partners: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Health of the Republic of Belarus
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Minsk, Belarus
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : IDUs, PLHIV, FSW, MSM, prisoners, youth, non-govenmental, state, international and medical organisations working in the sphere of HIV prevention
Contact person : UNDP Programme Officer:  Ms. Volha Kuzmianok Tel:   +375 (17) 327 48 76 e-mail: fo.blr@undp.org UNDP/GFATM Grants Implementation Unit in Belarus Tel: +375 (17) 200 06 46, +375 (17) 306 51 88 e-mail: giu@undp.org
Country: Belarus
Download Project Document : http://undp.by/f/file/rcc-prodoc-eng.doc
Project Name : Prevention and Treatment of HIV/AIDS in the Republic of Belarus – 2
Project starting date: January, 2010
Project ending data: December, 2015
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/00076047.html
Brief description : The project focuses on expanding the coverage of the main vulnerable groups and gradual institutionalization of the prevention and treatment activities so that by the end of the grant the government in partnership with the civil society can take over most of the activities. Grant implementation is focused on the following key objectives (i) change the behavior of the most vulnerable groups (injecting drug users (IDU), men who have sex with men (MSM), female sex workers (FSW), prison inmates, women, and youth) to less risky behavior in terms of HIV/AIDS transmission, (ii) ensure equal access of PLHIV to continuous treatment, care and support by means of strengthening the healthcare system and ARV therapy commitment programs, and (iii) create favorable conditions at the national and local levels for wide access to the prevention of HIV, the treatment and care of PLHIV.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 12,113,517.00
Funding Partners: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Health of the Republic of Belarus
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Minsk
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : IDUs, PLHIV, FSW, MSM, prisoners, youth, non-govenmental, state, international and medical organisations working in the sphere of HIV prevention
Contact person : UNDP Programme Officer:  Ms. Volha Kuzmianok Tel:   +375 (17) 327 48 76 e-mail: fo.blr@undp.org UNDP/GFATM Grants Implementation Unit in Belarus Tel: +375 (17) 200 06 46, +375 (17) 306 51 88 e-mail: giu@undp.org
Country: Belarus
Download Project Document : http://un.by/f/file/00077725-en.pdf
Project Name : Facilitating the Improvement of the Court System in Belarus through the Development of the Specialisation of Courts
Project starting date: June, 2012
Project ending data: September, 2013
Visit project website: http://undp.by/en/undp/db/77725.html
Brief description : The overall goal of the project in the long-term is to facilitate the improvement of access to justice for the Belarusian public at large, including socially vulnerable groups by ensuring effective and professional administration of justice. The project is focused on increasing the capacity of judges in Belarus through the improvement of their life-long education, providing access to relevant and specialized information about the practice of the administration of justice and by encouraging legislative improvements.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance

Total budget (USD): 355,400.00

Project Name : Emerging Donor: Support to National Capacities for Development Cooperation and Sharing EU Accession Knowledge with the region
Project starting date: 1 December, 2007
Project ending data: 31 December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=86021
Brief description : The project assisted Croatia in its transition from a recipient of official assistance to a donor country. It was designed to strengthen national capacities through the elaboration of a national strategy/programme for development cooperation and project management capabilities to plan, coordinate, deliver, monitor and evaluate development assistance. The project now facilitates sharing the knowledge about the European Union accession process with the countries from the South-East Europe region. The activities include training sessions/seminars, individual and team coaching, sharing good practice, publication and dissemination of materials and other similar work. The direct target beneficiaries of the project are the governmental officials involved in the EU integration process, and any other regional and local-level actors involved in the process.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 900,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs

Project Name : Programme Development of the European Centre for Cross-Sector Partnership – IMPACT
Project starting date: April, 2011
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=140191
Brief description : The purpose of the project is to further develop the programme of the IMPACT Centre, strengthen its organizational capacities and introduce the programme agenda to potential partners, target groups and the wider public. Specific objectives of the project lead to the creation of positive socio-economic effects and improvement of the capabilities of local authorities, civil society actors and business leaders to engage in meaningful partnerships for development:Cross-sector partnership is a concept that has become essential in defining socio-economic development, environmental protection and corporate social responsibility, stressing the need for involvement of the private sector and civil society in social development and social cohesion issues.

Project Name : Advocacy and Communication for Development
Project starting date: January, 2006
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=86037
Brief description : The UNDP development objective in Croatia responds to a simple statement – "Leave no citizen behind". UNDP Croatia is committed to support Croatia in all its efforts to achieve the highest degree of human dignity and prosperity for all its citizens irrespective of gender, creed or ethnicity. We strive to advocate and communicate sustainable human development, human security and equal opportunities in line with European and international norms, standards and commitments accepted by Croatia. Main activities of the project: advocating for specific causes championed by the UN through informed dialogues and debate, contributing to public education on specific issues, generating better understanding and awareness of UN and UNDP-embraced issues and activities, providing timely and accurate information on the activities, work, programmes, projects carried out by the UN and UNDP in Croatia, and providing media support for UN and UNDP activities, and media reporting on the UN/ UNDP-embraced issues in Croatia, and globally.

Project Name : Strengthening Social Inclusion Policies
Project starting date: 30 November, 2004
Project ending data: 31 December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=57934
Brief description : The project aims to contribute to enhanced inclusion policies monitoring framework; functional analysis of the social care system and the functional analysis of the social welfare system.. Policy options that are financially neutral and provide better services/benefits for users will be explored. The project complements the policy component with direct support to inclusive initiatives that aim at empowerment of vulnerable groups and prevention of their exclusion from society. It provides support to key national partners in assessing and designing practical policies and strategies for inclusion of its most vulnerable populations. Regional and gender differences, as well as reliable assessments of population at risk of social exclusion, are off particular importance in order for those groups to avoid further marginalization and receive adequate attention through participative and transparent strategic planning for their inclusion.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,315,598.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Social Policy and Youth, Croatian Bureau of Statistics, Ministry of War Veterans

Country: Croatia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.hr/upload/file/172/86131/FILENAME/DGTTF_People_with_Disabilities_CRO.doc
Project Name : Social Inclusion and People with Disabilities
Project starting date: 1 April, 2007
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=68253
Brief description : The basic aim of the project is to realize the rights of children and persons with intellectual and physical disabilities to achieve full participation in the community, the right to schooling in the regular educational system and the right to work. The project will utilize the rights-based approach, where persons with intellectual and physical disabilities are given support in claiming their rights, while institutions that are supposed to realize their rights will be supported in their realization of those rights. During implementation, this project will contribute to the development of good practice and support services in the area of foster care, inclusion and employment, and will be an evidence-based contribution to setting up and expanding community support services, developing criteria and standards of support and harmonizing national legislation with international regulations.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 874,213.00
Funding Partners: UNDP (DGTTF)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Social Policy and Youth, Ministry of Health, Ministry of War Veterans, Croatian Employment Service, Fund for Professional Rehabilitation and Employment of Persons with Disabilities, Employment Agency MojPosao, NGOs: Association for Promotion of Inclusion; Croatian Association for Professional Aid to Children with Special Needs 'IDEM'

Project Name : Respond to HIV/AIDS Support through UN Theme Group
Project starting date: January, 2006
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=86109
Brief description : UN agencies that are UNAIDS cosponsors (UNICEF, UNHCR, UNDP and WHO) and are present in Croatia have formed the UN Theme Group on HIV/AIDS in 2001. Their main objective is to coordinate the efforts of the UN system in support of the national response to the epidemic led by the National AIDS Commission using the mechanism and the advantages of collaborating through the joint UN response. Secretariat of the Group is based at UNDP. Three main pillars include: Supporting National AIDS Commission in implementing, National AIDS Strategy and other relevant strategic documents, Strengthening HIV/AIDS Surveillance and Human Rights.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 313,997.00
Funding Partners: UNAIDS, UNDP, UNHCR and UNICEF

Project Name : Respond to HIV/AIDS Capacity Building for WHO Knowledge Hub on HIV Surveillance and Monitoring & Evaluation
Project starting date: April, 2006
Project ending data: December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=70820
Brief description : The objective of this project was to support countries in the optimal access to and use of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria (GFATM) and other large grants through supporting the development of local technical capacity in launching large-scale responses to HIV/AIDS. The Knowledge Hub was designated the WHO Collaborating Centre for Capacity Building in HIV/AIDS Surveillance in March 2008. Specifically, the Knowledge Hub provides 18 different training modules in HIV/AIDS surveillance along with development of new training modules and teaching materials, and consultancies to the countries in development and implementation of HIV/AIDS surveillance
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS

Project Name : UN Theme Group PAF 3- targeting gaps
Project starting date: 1 January, 2007
Project ending data: 31 December, 2012
Visit project website:
Brief description : The project aims at increasing knowledge and familiarisation of the national implementing agencies with the most relevant and up to date national and international sources related to HIV/AIDS prevention and fighting stigma and discrimination including national capacity for preparing legal notions, drafts, publications, laws and by-laws corresponding to Croatian legal proceedings and international guidelines increased. It will also support evaluation of current National AIDS Strategy implementation, updated situation and response analysis.

Project Name : Socio-Economic Recovery of Areas of Special State Concern and under developed regions in Croatia: Banovina - Kordun Region
Project starting date: 1 January, 2006
Project ending data: 31 December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=57512
Brief description : The project aims at improving Socio-Economic Recovery of Areas of Special State Concern and under developed regions in Croatia (Banovina - Kordun Region, in targeted municipalities of Banovina Kordun area). It aims ato achieve the following outcomes (i) Key community support structures improved or established to address the needs of most vulnerable social groups, (ii) Limited (re)construction of infrastructure carried out, and (iii) Business development services, assistance to accessing investment capital and to public-private partnership establishment provided.

Country: Croatia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.hr/upload/file/170/85431/FILENAME/Project_Brief_ESR_Banovina_25.04.06.doc
Project Name : Socio-economic recovery of Areas of Special State Concern/Banovina Kordun region
Project starting date: 1 January, 2006
Project ending data: 31 December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=57512
Brief description : The project aims at the socio-economic recovery by supporting small and medium businesses to scale up job creation activities. It also provides assistance to socially excluded groups and individuals in the area with a special focus on refugees and internally displaced persons (IDPs) who, upon return, face difficulties in accessing basic infrastructure, community and social services, as well as employment or income generation activities. Central Croatian regions of Banovina and Kordun regions are still struggling to recover after the 1991-1995 conflict. Despite its increased vicinity to the capital Zagreb thanks to recent and ongoing infrastructure works, the counties rank very low in terms of social services, health and education. Return of refugees and influx of refugees from Bosnia has been larger here than in other parts of Croatia but it has not been met with increased employment opportunities or greenfield investment.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD):
Funding Partners: Government of Norway, the Netherlands Ministry for Development Cooperation, UNDP and local and regional self-governments
Implementing partners (both central and local): Implementing Partner: Sisak-Moslavina and Karlovac County
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kordun, Croatia
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : UNDP Program Officer: Nenad Kocmur Email: registry.hr@undp.org Phone: + (385 1) 23 61 666 Fax: + (385 1) 23 61 620
Country: Croatia

Project Name : Socio-economic recovery of Areas of Special State Concern: Lika-Dalmatian Hinternalnd
Project starting date: 1 September, 2006
Project ending data: 31 December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=57527
Brief description : The project intends to address the problems of relative poverty, social exclusion, increasing disparities and other structural problems of the Areas of Special State Concern (ASSC) and under-developed regions in southern Croatia areas of Lika and Dalmatian hinterland by focusing on the county, municipality and local community level. Additionally, a horizontal sub-programme will be implemented in order to address the issue of regional authorities' strategic development capacity building, the establishment of cross-sector partnerships and upgrading municipal and county development structures and institutions' absorption capacity towards national and donors' (primarily EC) funds.

Project Name : ARCH–Vukovar: Heritage as a means of development Reconstruction of Architectural Heritage in Vukovar Town Centre
Project starting date: June, 2011
Project ending data: June, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=138862
Brief description : The main aim of the project is to promote the economic and human development of the Vukovar community and to foster interethnic reconciliation by restoring the most symbolic secular monument of the urban historic centre: Radnički dom and the Worker's Hall. To restore the external appearance the Worker's Hall thereby contributing to the restoration of the town's material and non-material cultural heritage.To promote inter-cultural and inter-ethnic dialogue, increase the city's attractiveness to tourists together with improvement of the area's potential for overall economic development.

Project Name : Support to underdeveloped areas of Croatia to prepare for the EU CAP and Rural Development Policy
Project starting date: 2010
Project ending data: 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=128926
Brief description : This project aims to support local communities, small producers, and local authorities to prepare for the Common Agricultural Policy of the EU and to benefit from the Rural Development policies of the EU while dealing with climate changes as well. Addressing present problems, project provides support in following areas: Local Action Groups - establishment of democratic decision making structures, LAGs; Support to small producers and local authorities in preparation of project technical documentation; Better management of natural resources and adaptation to climate change; Diversification of the economy in the form of locally-owned, innovative small businesses, closely linked to landscape and biological diversity initiatives; Green Business Support Programme and The engagement of women and women's organizations

Project ending data: 2015
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?newscontainer=147839&page=51874&singlenewsid=147978#news147978
Brief description : The project aims at providing institutional support to ensure higher technical capacities for low-carbon and climate resilient development of Croatia. Support will be provided through partnership projects between public sector, experts, scientific communitiy, NGOs and private sector, at both national and regional level.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 263,190.00
Funding Partners: UNDP, CIEMAT, DHMZ, Faculty of Civil eng., Croatian Telecom

Country: Croatia

Project Name : Biodiversity in Croatia
Project starting date: July 2012
Project ending data: June 2014
Visit project website:
Brief description : The project aims at integrating Croatia’s obligations under the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) into its national development and sectoral planning frameworks through a renewed and participative ‘biodiversity planning’ and strategizing process, in a manner that is in line with the global guidance contained in the CBD’s Strategic Plan for 2011-2020.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 250,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP, GEF
Implementing partners (both central and local): State Institute for Nature Protection

Project Name : Energy efficency project
Project starting date: January 2011
Project ending data: December 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=57802
Brief description : The Project aims at removing barriers for the implementation of economically feasible, energy efficient technologies and measures in residential and public sectors in Croatia, with the final goal to reduce energy consumption and the associated greenhouse gases, and rising public awareness about efficient use of energy. Important role of the Project is directed to strenghtening public service sector capacities (at cities, counties and central-government level) to systematically manage energy consumption in buildings, to identify and implement energy efficiency measures with the final result in reduced costs for energy, energy consumption and GHG emissions.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 7,543,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP, Croatian Fund for Environment Protection and Energy Efficiency, Government of Croatia, private sector
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Economy, Ministry of Construction and Physical Planning
Number of project staff : 10
Name of the location (region/district, village): Zagreb, Croatia
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Sandra Vlašić, Environmental Governance Programme Officer Email: registry.hr@undp.org Phone: + (385 1) 23 61 666 Fax: + (385 1) 23 61 620
Country: Croatia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.hr/upload/file/157/78666/FILENAME/Project_COAST.doc
Project Name : Conservation and Sustainable Use of Biodiversity in the Dalmatian Coast (COAST)
Project starting date: 2007
Project ending data: 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=57734
Brief description : The project objective is to effectively transform the current practices of the tourism, agriculture and fishery sectors in these four coastal countries to include elements of biodiversity and landscape conservation. Direct as well as indirect influence through the banking sector would be used in order to achieve these goals.It will help Croatia seize a unique and short-lived opportunity to improve the conservation of globally significant biodiversity in the Dalmatian coastal region before tourism and related economic development cause irreversible damage to the ecosystems. It will also remove barriers to transforming socio-economic sectors and so unleash positive forces for sustainable use of biodiversity.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 6,987,999.00
Funding Partners: GEF, UNDP, Environmental Protection and Energy Efficiency Fund, Government of Croatia, county governments
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Environment and Nature Protection; Ministry of Tourism; Ministry of Agriculture; Ministry of Culture; National Physical Planning Institute; State Institute for Nature Protection; Environmental
Number of project staff : 6
Name of the location (region/district, village): Zadar, Croatia
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Sandra Vlašić, Environmental Governance Programme Officer Email: registry.hr@undp.org Phone: + (385 1) 23 61 666 Fax: + (385 1) 23 61 620
Country: Croatia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.hr/upload/file/157/78666/FILENAME/Project_COAST.doc

Project Name : Assistance in the Development of a Witness and Victim Support System
Project starting date: 2012
Project ending data: 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=86296
Brief description : This project will focus on formalising cooperation between CJS institutions and civil sector by using the potential of young enthusiastic people and ensuring their participation in improving and bringing services closer to citizens. It will focus on strengthened capacity of the CJS to respond to the needs of victims and witnesses and to protect their rights and improved visibility and accessibility of witness and victim support (WVS) mechanisms and services.

Project Name : Arms control and Security. Support in enforcement of systematic crime prevention work and establishment of crime prevention coordination unit 
Project starting date: 2010
Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.hr/show.jsp?page=86220
Brief description : The project will provide support in four complementary areas which are taken as a whole structured in a way to influence measurable improvement in the work and development of a crime prevention system at national and local level between actual structural Ministry of Interior units, cooperation with other relevant governmental, public and private bodies and institutions, strengthening the consistent implementation as well as the implementation of community policing. Output 1. Establishment of Crime Prevention Coordination Unit at Police Directorate with technical and professional support of UNDP and its activities. Output 2. Improvement of work and development of crime prevention system. Output 3. Establishment and strengthening of consistent model for functional Crime Prevention Councils. Output 4. Continuation of institutional support, education and visibility of community policing model
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,100,000.00
Funding Partners: Destruction for Development Programme)
Implementing partners (both central and local):
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Zagreb, Croatia
Number of beneficiaries:

Country: Croatia

Project Name : Assistance to electoral process in Georgia
Project starting date: 25 April, 2012
Project ending data: 25 April,2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=183
Brief description : The project aims at supporting the electoral process in Georgia with the objective to enhance national democratic institutions and ensure fair electoral process and active civil participation.The main areas of project support focused on qualified electoral administration and other electoral stakeholders, electoral legislation and informed voters. Key words: democracy, elections, voters, enhancing credibility.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,378,881.98
Funding Partners: EU: 1,242,236 USD; UNDP:136,646 USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): electoral administration, political parties, domestic observers, voters and the media
Number of project staff : 5
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries: 49,500
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Central Election Commission, the Cemter of Electoral System Development, Reforms and Training; 48,000 Presinct Electoral Commission members; 949 District Electoral Commission members; 60 political party representatives, 169 media reprsentaties, 20 representatives of major oberver groups.
Contact person : Gigi Bregadze Democratic Governance Programme Analyst registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia

Project Name : Assistance to electoral process in Georgia
Project starting date: 25 April, 2012
Project ending data: 25 April,2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=183
Brief description : The project aims at supporting the electoral process in Georgia with the objective to enhance national democratic institutions and ensure fair electoral process and active civil participation.The main areas of project support focused on qualified electoral administration and other electoral stakeholders, electoral legislation and informed voters. Key words: democracy, elections, voters, enhancing credibility.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,378,881.98
Funding Partners: EU: 1,242,236USD; UNDP: 136,646USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): electoral administration, political parties, domestic observers, voters and the media
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Zestaponi Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 48,000 Presinct Electoral Commission members; 949 District Electoral Commission members; 60 political party representatives, 169 media reprsentaties, 20 representatives of major oberver groups.
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Central Election Commission, the Cemter of Electoral System Development, Reforms and Training;
Contact person : Gigi Bregadze Democratic Governance Programme Analyst registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/EU-UNDP-agreement-2012-05.pdf

Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=183
Brief description : The project aims at supporting the electoral process in Georgia with the objective to enhance national democratic institutions and ensure fair electoral process and active civil participation.The main areas of project support focused on qualified electoral administration and other electoral stakeholders, electoral legislation and informed voters. Key words: democracy, elections, voters, enhancing credibility.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,378,881.98
Funding Partners: EU: 1,242,236USD; UNDP: 136,646USD 110,000EUR UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): electoral administration, political parties, domestic observers, voters and the media
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Tianeti Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 48,000 Presinct Electoral Commission members; 949 District Electoral Commission members; 60 political party representatives, 169 media reprsentaties, 20 representatives of major oberver groups.
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Central Election Commission, the Cemter of Electoral System Development, Reforms and Training;
Contact person : Gigi Bregadze Democratic Governance Programme Analyst registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/EU-UNDP-agreement-2012-05.pdf

Key words: democracy, elections, voters, enhancing credibility.

Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,378,881.98
Funding Partners: EU: 1,242,236USD; UNDP: 136,646USD 110,000EUR UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): electoral administration, political parties, domestic observers, voters and the media
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Bolnisi Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 48,000 Presinct Electoral Commission members; 949 District Electoral Commission members; 60 political party representatives, 169 media reprsentaties, 20 representatives of major oberver groups.
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Central Election Commission, the Cemter of Electoral System Development, Reforms and Training;
Contact person : Gigi Bregadze Democratic Governance Programme Analyst registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia

Project Name : Assistance to electoral process in Georgia
Project starting date: 25 April, 2012
Project ending data: 25 April,2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=183
Brief description : The project aims at supporting the electoral process in Georgia with the objective to enhance national democratic institutions and ensure fair electoral process and active civil participation.The main areas of project support focused on qualified electoral administration and other electoral stakeholders, electoral legislation and informed voters. Key words: democracy, elections, voters, enhancing credibility.

Project Name : Enhancing Gender Equality in Georgia
Project starting date: 31 October, 2011
Project ending data: 31 October, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=184
Brief description : The project aims at addressing the challenges of equal opportunities and women empowerment in Georgia, it focuses on the three main area: women’s political and economic empowerment, eliminating violence against women, especially domestic violence and realization of sexual and reproductive rights of population. Key words: gender, women empowerment, economic empowerment, eliminating domestic violence, democracy.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 2,087,738.00
Funding Partners: Sida (Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency
Implementing partners (both central and local): Parliament of Georgia
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries: 215
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Parliament Gender Equality Council, 16 Municipalities
Contact person : Natia Natsvlishvili Democratic Governance Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/gender-jp-prodoc.pdf

Project Name : Enhancing Gender Equality in Georgia
Project starting date: 31 October, 2011
Project ending data: 31 October, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=184
Brief description : The project aims at addressing the challenges of equal opportunities and women empowerment in Georgia, it focuses on the three main area: women’s political and economic empowerment, eliminating violence against women, especially domestic violence and realization of sexual and reproductive rights of population. Key words: gender, women empowerment, economic empowerment, eliminating domestic violence, democracy.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 2,087,738.00
Funding Partners: Sida (Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency
Implementing partners (both central and local): Parliament of Georgia
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Abasha Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 16 female MPs, 199 female members of local councils nationa-wide
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Parliament Gender Equality Council, 16 Municipalities
Contact person : Natia Natsvlishvili Democratic Governance Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/gender-jp-prodoc.pdf

Project Name : Development of Media Monitoring Capacities in Georgia Elene Aladashvili 577-97-40-04
Project starting date: 25 April, 2010
Project ending data: 31 January, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=147; www.mediamonitor.ge
Brief description : The project aims at supporting civil society organizations to monitor media performance, with the overall objectives of raising professional standards of the media in Georgia and supporting independent and impartial reporting. This includes: monitoring and analyzing media performance, especially related to pre-election coverage, discussing findings of media monitoring with media outlets and professionals, training reporters on standards during election coverage, and how to address issues identified during media monitoring and identifying criteria to measure professionalism of journalists and editors. Key words: democracy, civil society, media performance, election, media monitoring, media outlets, election coverage, journalists.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 670,659.74
Funding Partners: European Union (EU)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Georgian Public Broadcaster
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries: 7 local CSOs trainned in media monitoring; 7 TV stations and 12 radio stations, 10 print media outlets, 12 online media outlets qualitatively and quantitaively monitored by local CSOs and assessed by local media experts
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Georgian Public Broadcaster, Georgian public at large
Contact person : Gigi Bregadze Democratic Governance Programme Analyst registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/parliament-prodoc-2010-signed.pdf
Project Name : A Strong Parliament in a Consolidated Democracy
Project starting date: 01 January, 2010
Project ending data: 30-Jun-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=120
Brief description : UNDP assists the Georgian parliament in its efforts to more effectively represent the needs and views of Georgian citizens, to simplify law-making procedures, and to improve human resource management and public relations. The project aims to support the parliament in the four main areas of its constitutional responsibility: lawmaking, setting policy direction, executive oversight, and representation. The three main focuses of the project involve one or more of those responsibilities: Strengthening the parliament’s role in the budget process; Supporting the parliament’s work in the area of local self-government, and Strengthening technical support to committees and factions. Key words: democracy, reform, gender, regulation, law making, finance.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 972,547.00
Funding Partners: UNDP: 80,000USDl GoG: 105,820USD: Metherlands: 786,727USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Parliament of Georgia
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries: Over 200 MPs and staff of the Parliament
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Parliament
Contact person : Gigi Bregadze Democratic Governance Programme Analyst registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/parliament-prodoc-2010-signed.pdf

Project Name : South Caucasus Integrated Border Management (SCIBM)
Project starting date: 01 January, 2009
Project ending data: 30 September, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=116
Brief description : The South Caucasus Integrated Border Management project envisages five modules each aiming to achieve concrete and tangible results: 1. Raising IBM Awareness & Supporting Strategic Border Management Capacity 2. SCIBM Planning and Strengthening of Operational Techniques 3. Training and Pilot Programmes Development 4. Equipment and IT Systems 5. SCIBM Implementation - Establishment of Pilot Border Crossing Points. Key words: Democracy, reform, capacity building, border managment, IT system
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 235,058.36
Funding Partners: European Union (EU)
Implementing partners (both central and local): International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)
Number of project staff : 5
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Enternal Affairs, Revenue Service, National Security Council
Contact person : Natia Natsvlishvili Democratic Governance Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia

Project Name : Income Generation and Employment through Skills Development
Project starting date: 01 January, 2012
Project ending data: 12 January, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=168
Brief description : The project contributes to improving the quality of vocational education and training, and increasing incomes and employment among the poor. The initiative is focusing on the four strategic areas: Improve the quality of vocational education through linking policy development to the labour market trends and through increasing access to the advanced teaching methodologies and training practices. Increase public awareness about vocational education, its services and service providers through the tailor-made information campaigns and public-private dialogue. Enhance sustainability of the vocational colleges through positioning them as facilitators of employment, partners to local businesses and as hubs for supporting small-scale economic activities in the region. Establish the links between vocational education and professional activities, researchers, experts and vocational workers. Key words: Economic development, poverty reduction, agriculture extension service, souvenirs, handicraft development, construction sector.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 430,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): Akhaltsikhe VET Kachreti VET Kutaisi VET
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kachreti village
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Vocational Training (VET) Centers of Kutaisi, Kachreti, Akhaltsikhe, Poti, Ambrolauri and Rustavi
Contact person : George Nanobashvili Economic Development Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/prodoc-VET4-signed.pdf

Name of the location (region/district, village): Gurjaani Municipality
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Vocational Training (VET) Centers of Kutaisi, Kachreti, Akhaltsikhe, Poti, Ambrolauri and Rustavi
Contact person : George Nanobashvili Economic Development Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/prodoc-VET4-signed.pdf
Project Name : Income Generation and Employment through Skills Development
Project starting date: 01 January, 2012
Project ending data: 12 January, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=168
Brief description : The project contributes to improving the quality of vocational education and training, and increasing incomes and employment among the poor. The initiative is focusing on the four strategic areas: Improve the quality of vocational education through linking policy development to the labour market trends and through increasing access to the advanced teaching methodologies and training practices. Increase public awareness about vocational education, its services and service providers through the tailor-made information campaigns and public-private dialogue. Enhance sustainability of the vocational colleges through positioning them as facilitators of employment, partners to local businesses and as hubs for supporting small-scale economic activities in the region. Establish the links between vocational education and professional activities, researchers, experts and vocational workers. Key words: Economic development, poverty reduction, agriculture extension service, souvenirs, handicraft development, construction sector.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 430,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): Akhaltsikhe VET Kachreti VET Kutaisi VET
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Lagodekhi Municipality
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Vocational Training (VET) Centers of Kutaisi, Kachreti, Akhaltsikhe, Poti, Ambrolauri and Rustavi
Contact person : George Nanobashvili Economic Development Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
