Project Name : Livelihood Development of Vulnerable Communities in the Shida Kartli Region
Project starting date: 01 November, 2011
Project ending data: 03 October, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=167
Brief description : The programme assists the displaced and host communities in the Shida Kartli region through promoting small-scale farming and raising household income of farming families. The project will establish a value chain linking up farmers, the farmers’ associations, food processing facilities and service providers with each other, and strengthening their capacity thorough trainings, extension support and access to markets. The project includes three components: 1.Consulting service to farmers to increase yield and productivity; 2.Demonstration projects in food processing and preservation; 3.Improved access to agriculture market through harvest consolidation. Key words: Economic development, poverty reduction, farming, extension centers, internally displaced people.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 300,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP: 80,000USD; UNHCR (United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees): 220,000USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): NGO Nergebi
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kaspi Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 300
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Farmers' Cooperative Nikozi
Contact person : George Nanobashvili Economic Development Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/prodoc-Ajara3.pdf
Project Name : Support to Trade Development in Adjara Autonomous Republic
Project starting date: 01 May, 2011
Project ending data: 30-Apr-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=163
Brief description : As part of its larger programme for economic development of the Ajara Autonomous Republic, UNDP helps promote trade in goods and services. This initiative contributes to the effective positioning of the regional goods and services on the domestic and foreign markets. Furthermore, it supports local businesses in marketing, and helps facilitate export and empower relevant agencies. To increase effectiveness and efficiency of the regional agriculture and farming the largest employer for the vulnerable rural population – the project assists the development of value added chains and facilitates their access to the market The project includes the following activities: Business Development Services, improvement of professional skills and employment prospects in agriculture and tourism sectors, trade promotion in the areas of agriculture and services (tourism) and facilitation of foreign trade and promotion of foreign investments. Key words: poverty reduction, economic development, tourism, agriculture, business, markets.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 449,591.00
Funding Partners: Government of Finland
Implementing partners (both central and local): Batumi Business Incubator Batumi Vocational College "Black Sea" Ajara Agroservice Center
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Batumi
Number of beneficiaries: 5000
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Batumi Business Incubator; Batumi Vocational College "Black Sea"; Ajara Agroservice Center; Batumi Tourism Agency; Ajara Tourism Department
Contact person : George Nanobashvili Economic Development Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/prodoc-Ajara3.pdf
Project Name : Support to Trade Development in Adjara Autonomous Republic
Project starting date: 01 May, 2011
Project ending data: 30-Apr-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=163
Brief description : As part of its larger programme for economic development of the Ajara Autonomous Republic, UNDP helps promote trade in goods and services. This initiative contributes to the effective positioning of the regional goods and services on the domestic and foreign markets. Furthermore, it supports local businesses in marketing, and helps facilitate export and empower relevant agencies. To increase effectiveness and efficiency of the regional agriculture and farming the largest employer for the vulnerable rural population – the project assists the development of value added chains and facilitates their access to the market The project includes the following activities: Business Development Services, improvement of professional skills and employment prospects in agriculture and tourism sectors, trade promotion in the areas of agriculture and services (tourism) and facilitation of foreign trade and promotion of foreign investments. Key words: poverty reduction, economic development, tourism, agriculture, business, markets.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 449,591.00
Funding Partners: Government of Finland
Implementing partners (both central and local): Batumi Business Incubator Batumi Vocational College "Black Sea" Ajara Agroservice Center
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Keda Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 25 small local businesses went through Incubation program; more than 750 people received business trainings through Trade Promotion Center; Up to 600 people retrained in the vocations most demanded on the labour market; Local farmers benefiting from receiving agricultural inputs: 1,800 units of citrus crops and 600 units of fruit crops; More than 500 farmers consulted in Agronomy, Veterinary, Animal Husbandry and nursery; More than 150 farmers received practical aid by Soil laboratory (broad range of soil, water and other tests to the farmers); More than 130 households have been introduced and practically assisted with artificial insemination; 42 guides (English, Russian, Turkish language) have been retrained for Batumi Tourism Agency and Ajara Tourism Department;
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Batumi Business Incubator; Batumi Vocational College "Black Sea"; Ajara Agroservice Center; Batumi Tourism Agency; Ajara Tourism Department
Contact person : George Nanobashvili Economic Development Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/prodoc-Ajara3.pdf
Project Name : Support to Trade Development in Adjara Autonomous Republic
Project starting date: 01 May, 2011
Project ending data: 30-Apr-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=163
Brief description : As part of its larger programme for economic development of the Ajara Autonomous Republic, UNDP helps promote trade in goods and services. This initiative contributes to the effective positioning of the regional goods and services on the domestic and foreign markets. Furthermore, it supports local businesses in marketing, and helps facilitate export and empower relevant agencies. To increase effectiveness and efficiency of the regional agriculture and farming the largest employer for the vulnerable rural population – the project assists the development of value added chains and facilitates their access to the market The project includes the following activities: Business Development Services, improvement of professional skills and employment prospects in agriculture and tourism sectors, trade promotion in the areas of agriculture and services (tourism) and facilitation of foreign trade and promotion of foreign investments. Key words: poverty reduction, economic development, tourism, agriculture, business, markets.

Project Name : Integrated Socio-Economic Development of Pankisi Valley
Project starting date: 01 February, 2011
Project ending data: 31 January, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=156
Brief description : The initiative is designed to: 1. Assist transitional strategy from direct individual humanitarian assistance to sustainable human development for all communities, including refugees in Pankisi Valley, 2. Strengthen the national system of protection of refugees in a broader context of democratic governance, addressing poverty and promoting sustainable human development in Pankisi Valley. Key words: Poverty reduction, refugees, sustainable human development, democarcy.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 620,000.00
Funding Partners: SDC (Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation): 420,000USD UNHCR (United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees): 200,000USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Telavi VET
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Akhmeta Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: Up to 50 familes benefitting from supplying raw milk to cheese plant; up to 200 farmers benefiting from extension services, 15 local veterinaries, up to 1400 farmers' cow vaccinated; 38 farmers benfitting from technological upgrade projects; 130 adults retrainned; 22 farmers benefiting from artificial insemination services; 7 people retrainned and employed in Akhmeta Diary Mini-Plant established by the project.
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Akhmeta Venerinary Association
Contact person : George Nanobashvili Economic Development Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/social-services-prodoc-2012.pdf
Project Name : Support to Social Service Capacities in Georgia - Phase 2
Project starting date: 15 January, 2012
Project ending data: 30 June, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=79
Brief description : This project complements an initiative of the Swiss agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) on the Social Housing in Supportive Environment (SHSE) that provides the most vulnerable people with affordable housing in Tbilisi, Rustavi, Bolnisi and Batumi municipalities. The project envisages strengthening of the capacities of the respective municipal authorities in social services to make an informed selection of the beneficiaries for the Social Houses, improve services provided to the beneficiaries and the public in general and supporting beneficiaries to accommodate themselves at the provided premises. The project will also make a greater emphasis to strengthen Rustavi municipal social service in analyzing and establishing adequate social programmes to their constituency. Key words: vulnerable population, social housing
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 100,000.00
Funding Partners: SDC (Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation)
Implementing partners (both central and local): NGO Georgian Association of Social Workers
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries: 60 families benefiting from social housing services; Up to 25 staff members of Social Units of Bolnisi and Tbilisi Municipalities trainned on social work.
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Local authorities of Bolnisi, Rustavi, Batumi and Tbilisi
Contact person : George Nanobashvili Economic Development Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document :

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/PROJECT%20DOCUMENT_Sustainable%20Livelihoods_forestry.doc
Project Name : Promote Sustainable Livelihoods and Responsible Attitude to Environment
Project starting date: 01 April, 2012
Project ending data: 31 March, 2015
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=179
Brief description : The Project will focus on the sustainable livelihoods, responsible attitude to environment and disaster risk reduction in the areas (Daba and Tsagveri in Borjomi municipality) affected by forest fires in 2008 armed conflict. It will support income generation activities particularly those related to safe environment; it will pilot alternative energy systems and energy efficiency measures to the selected local families, schools and municipality buildings and will introduce informal environmental education through eco clubs, eco camps and green schools in line with the Government’s strategy: ‘Environmental Education for Sustainable Development’. The above activities will be accompanied by community mobilization, training and support to ensure local participation, ownership and capacity to manage natural resources in the best possible way. Lessons learned and techniques proven on site will be replicated elsewhere in the country, primarily in Samtskhe Javakheti region. Key words: Environment, climate change, green, energy, community empowerment and capacity building.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 1,505,593.00
Funding Partners: Government of Finland
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Environment Protection of Georgia.UNDP Georgia; Borjomi National Park Authorities; Agency for Protected Areas; Borjomi Municilality local authorities, local NGOs
Number of project staff : 4
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Borjomi
Number of beneficiaries: Farmers and guest house owners of 4 targeted villages with the total poluation of 2044 persons; Up to 1800 school children from 6 schools in Borjomi municipality
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nino Antadze Energy and Environment Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/PROJECT%20DOCUMENT_Sustainable%20Livelihoods_forestry.doc

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/POPs-prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Disposal of POPs Pesticides and Initial Steps for Containment of Dumped POPs Pesticides in Georgia
Project starting date: 01 January, 2011
Project ending data: 31 December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=170
Brief description : The project objective is to “minimize releases of POPs (Persistent Organic Pollutants) from obsolete pesticide stockpiles in Georgia and create capacity in management of the POPs pesticide stockpiles”. The project objective will directly contribute to the broader goal “support to sustainable development through elimination of POPs from the environment”. Outcomes of the Project are: Legal and administrative capacity strengthened will assure that pre-conditions, such as training and improvement of legal basis necessary for project implementation and further POPs related hazardous waste management issues are met, Minimization of releases from obsolete pesticide dumps and Established project monitoring, accumulation of experience and dissemination of lessons learnt. Key words: Environment, climate change, legal basis.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 1,150,000.00
Funding Partners: Global Environmental Facility (GEF) : 1,000,000USD UNDP: 150,000USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Environment Protection of Georgia
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Marneuli Municipality
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Agriculture, Marneuli Municipality authorities, Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Economic Development
Contact person : Nino Antadze Energy and Environment Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/UNFCC-TNC-prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Enabling Activities for the Preparation of Georgia's Third National Communication to the UNFCCC
Project starting date: 20 July, 2010
Project ending data: 31-Dec-14
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=169
Brief description : The Third National Communication to the UNFCCC is the continuation and compilation of the works conducted under the second national communication to the UNFCCC and the other climate change related programmes. The Third National Communication will: Update and strengthen information provided regarding national and regional circumstances, priorities and strategies; Prepare the green house gas (GHG) inventory for different sectors of economy for the period 2006-2012; Assess vulnerability to climate change of ecosystems and economy sectors in the different regions of Georgia and develop the adaptation measures; Construct GHGs emissions scenarios by 2050 and identify the relevant mitigation measures and strategies; Facilitate the integration of climate change risks assessment and ways of risks reduction in the different strategies prepared by the country and provide scientifically and statistically proved information on climate change risks in Georgia. Key words: climate change, environment, risk assessment.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 500,000.00
Funding Partners: Global Environmental Facility (GEF)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Environment Protection of Georgia
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Tbilisi, Batumi and all communites of Ajara; Mestia, Kakheti all municiality
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Local authorities of the municipalities of Ajara, Kakheti and Zemo Svaneti;Ajara Department of Tourism, Ajara Forestry Agency, Ajara Ministry of Agriculture, Ajara Dept of Natural Resources and Env Protection
Contact person : Nino Antadze Energy and Environment Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/UNFCC-TNC-prodoc.pdf

Project Name : Enabling Activities for the Preparation of Georgia's Third National Communication to the UNFCCC
Project starting date: 20 July, 2010
Project ending data: 31-Dec-14
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=169
Brief description : The Third National Communication to the UNFCCC is the continuation and compilation of the works conducted under the second national communication to the UNFCCC and the other climate change related programmes. The Third National Communication will: Update and strengthen information provided regarding national and regional circumstances, priorities and strategies; Prepare the green house gas (GHG) inventory for different sectors of economy for the period 2006-2012; Assess vulnerability to climate change of ecosystems and economy sectors in the different regions of Georgia and develop the adaptation measures; Construct GHGs emissions scenarios by 2050 and identify the relevant mitigation measures and strategies; Facilitate the integration of climate change risks assessment and ways of risks reduction in the different strategies prepared by the country and provide scientifically and statistically proved information on climate change risks in Georgia. Key words: climate change, environment, risk assessment.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 500,000.00
Funding Partners: Global Environmental Facility (GEF)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Environment Protection of Georgia
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kvareli Municipality
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Local authorities of the municipalities of Ajara, Kakheti and Zemo Svaneti;Ajara Department of Tourism, Ajara Forestry Agency, Ajara Ministry of Agriculture, Ajara Dept of Natural Resources and Env Protection
Contact person : Nino Antadze Energy and Environment Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/cpaf-2010-2016-prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Ensuring Sufficiency and Predictability of Revenues for the Georgia’s Protected Areas System
Project starting date: 01 July, 2010
Project ending data: 30 June, 2016
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=151
Brief description : The project is designed to achieve a desired scenario in which the basic operating and investment needs of the protected areas system in Georgia will be more than 100% covered, and coverage of the optimal needs will be increased to 70% in 5-7 years, ensuring long-term integrity of the habitats and species protected by the priority PAs. The project aims to help increase financial sustainability of the protected areas system. The project works to ensure stable revenue sources for the protected areas and improve business planning and cost-effectiveness of site management. Key words: Environment, energy,protected areas, income generation.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 1,000,000.00
Funding Partners: Global Environmental Facility (GEF)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Agency of Protected Areas of Georgia;
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Borjomi-Kharagauli National Park
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Agency of Protected Areas of Georgia;
Contact person : Nestan Khuntsaria Programme Associate registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/cpaf-2010-2016-prodoc.pdf

Project Name : Reducing Trans-Boundary Degradation in the Kura-Aras Basin
Project starting date: 01 July, 2009
Project ending data: 30 June, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=102
Brief description : A principal focus of the project is to assist the Kura-Aras riparian states in balancing overuse and conflicting uses of water resources in trans-boundary surface and groundwater basins. The project assists to:Identify the principal threats and root causes of the trans-boundary water resources of the Kura Aras-River Trans-boundary Basin, and develop and implement a sustainable programme for policy, legal and institutional reforms and investments to address these threats. Key words: Environment, water overuse, grandwater, conflict.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 2,900,000.00
Funding Partners: Global Environmental Facility (GEF)
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNOPS
Number of project staff : 5
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries: Population of Kura-Arax basin (up to 2.7 million people)
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Energy, Ministry of Agriculture, National Center for Desease Control and Public Health, Tbilisi State University, Tbilisi Technical University, National Environment Agency
Contact person : Nino Antadze Energy and Environment Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia

Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=102
Brief description : A principal focus of the project is to assist the Kura-Aras riparian states in balancing overuse and conflicting uses of water resources in trans-boundary surface and groundwater basins. The project assists to:Identify the principal threats and root causes of the trans-boundary water resources of the Kura Aras-River Trans-boundary Basin, and develop and implement a sustainable programme for policy, legal and institutional reforms and investments to address these threats. Key words: Environment, water overuse, grandwater, conflict.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 2,900,000.00
Funding Partners: Global Environmental Facility (GEF)
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNOPS
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Tetri Tsqaro Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: Population of Kura-Arax basin (up to 2.7 million people)
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Energy, Ministry of Agriculture, National Center for Desease Control and Public Health, Tbilisi State University, Tbilisi Technical University, National Environment Agency
Contact person : Nino Antadze Energy and Environment Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/kura-aras-prodoc.pdf

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/AF_Project_ENG.doc
Project Name : Developing Climate Resilient Flood and Flash Flood Management Practices to Protect Vulnerable Communities of Georgia
Project starting date: 30 November, 2010
Project ending data: 30 November, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=180
Brief description : The project objective is to improve resilience of highly exposed regions of Georgia to hydro-meteorological threats that are increasing in frequency and intensity as a result of climate change. The project will help the government and the population of the target region of Rioni Basin to develop adaptive capacity and embark on climate resilient economic development. The project is comprised of three main components: 1. Floodplain development policy introduced to incentivize long term resilience to flood / flash flood risks; 2. Climate resilient practices of flood management developed and implemented to reduce vulnerability of highly exposed communities; 3. Early warning system in place to improve preparedness and adaptive capacity of population.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 5,060,000.00
Funding Partners: Adaptation Fund: 4,900,000USD, UNDP: 160,000USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Environment Protection of Georgia; Ministry of Internal Affairs of Georgi; Ministry of Regional Development and Infrastructure of Georgia; National Environmental Agency,
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Ambrolauri Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 200,000 people from Rioni basin
Name of beneficiaries or organization : National Environmental Agency, local authorities of 6 municipalities
Contact person : Nino Antadze Energy and Environment Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/AF_Project_ENG.doc

Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/AF_Project_ENG.doc
Project Name : Developing Climate Resilient Flood and Flash Flood Management Practices to Protect Vulnerable Communities of Georgia
Project starting date: 30 November, 2010
Project ending data: 30 November, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=180
Brief description : The project objective is to improve resilience of highly exposed regions of Georgia to hydro-meteorological threats that are increasing in frequency and intensity as a result of climate change. The project will help the government and the population of the target region of Rioni Basin to develop adaptive capacity and embark on climate resilient economic development. The project is comprised of three main components: 1. Floodplain development policy introduced to incentivize long term resilience to flood / flash flood risks; 2. Climate resilient practices of flood management developed and implemented to reduce vulnerability of highly exposed communities; 3. Early warning system in place to improve preparedness and adaptive capacity of population.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 5,060,000.00
Funding Partners: Adaptation Fund: 4,900,000USD, UNDP: 160,000USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Environment Protection of Georgia; Ministry of Internal Affairs of Georgi; Ministry of Regional Development and Infrastructure of Georgia; National Environmental Agency,
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Samtredia Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 200,000 people from Rioni basin
Name of beneficiaries or organization : National Environmental Agency, local authorities of 6 municipalities
Contact person : Nino Antadze Energy and Environment Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/prodoc-SALW1.pdf
Project Name : Georgia Ammunition Demilitarization and Community Security Programme
Project starting date: 17 October, 2011
Project ending data: 30 June, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=171
Brief description : The project intends to achieve the following results: Ammunition demilitarization through transportation of ammunition from the relevant military bases to the demilitarization facilities (Ponichala, Vaziani and Dedoplitskaro); Inter-ministerial coordination on the issues related to Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW) control, ammunition demilitarization, etc; Enhancing environmental/community security through developing environmental remediation plans, with community participation, that identify priority interventions and options for engagement at the community level.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 821,640.00
Funding Partners: OSCE (Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe): 671,640USD UNDP: 150,000USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): DELTA (Legal Entity of Public Law
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Vaziani village
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Georgian community at large
Contact person : Nils Christensen Crisis Prevention and Recovery Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/prodoc-SALW1.pdf

Download Project Document :
Project Name : Confidence Building Early Response Mechanism (COBERM) - Phase 2
Project starting date: 2-Jun-12
Project ending data: 2-Jun-15
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=141
Brief description : COBERM is an early response mechanism, established to support immediate and concrete initiatives, which seek to have a demonstrable impact on confidence building within and across conflict divided communities. The overall objective of COBERM is to foster a peaceful transformation of conflicts. Specific objectives are to: 1. Enhance direct people-to-people contacts across conflict divides to shatter myths/prejudices and foster the culture of tolerance between and within communities affected and/or at risk of a violent conflict. 2. Strengthen local and national peace building initiatives to provide direct peace dividends to communities affected and/or at risk of a violent conflict. 3. Enhance peace enabling environment through increased capacities within communities, civil society, media and governments to mediate political differences through peaceful and constructive ways.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 6,476,683.94
Funding Partners: European Union (EU)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Local NGOs
Number of project staff : 5
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kaspi Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 90, 875 people benefiting from 62 confidence building projects
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nils Christensen Crisis Prevention and Recovery Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document :

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/PDA-prodoc-signed.PDF
Project Name : Peace and Development Programme
Project starting date: 01 April, 2010
Project ending data: 30-Jun-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=143
Brief description : The project aims at providing preparatory assistance to the UNDP office and the UN Country Team in Georgia to explore entry points and new opportunities for the UN system to engage in conflict prevention and peace and development initiatives and to contribute to the strengthening of national governmental and non-governmental capacities for conflict prevention and peace building from a national as well as sub-regional point of view. This includes the restoration of confidence and peaceful coexistence in the conflict affected areas of the country as well as support to the complex and conflict prone democratic transition process that the country is currently experimenting. The programme supports the strengthening of national governmental and non-governmental capacities to address and manage different political challenges and contested issues in a sustainable and peaceful manner. Strengthening of national mechanisms for consensus-building, institutional strengthening of conflict resolution capacities on local and national levels, and the development leadership capacities will be critical for this purpose.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 905,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP Georgia
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries: General public, population of 18 comunities along South Ossetia Administrative Border Line (ABL)
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Security providers including Ministry of nterior, local NGOs, EUMM
Contact person : Nils Christensen Crisis Prevention and Recovery Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/PDA-prodoc-signed.PDF
Project Name : Peace and Development Programme
Project starting date: 01 April, 2010
Project ending data: 30-Jun-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=143
Brief description : The project aims at providing preparatory assistance to the UNDP office and the UN Country Team in Georgia to explore entry points and new opportunities for the UN system to engage in conflict prevention and peace and development initiatives and to contribute to the strengthening of national governmental and non-governmental capacities for conflict prevention and peace building from a national as well as sub-regional point of view. This includes the restoration of confidence and peaceful coexistence in the conflict affected areas of the country as well as support to the complex and conflict prone democratic transition process that the country is currently experimenting. The programme supports the strengthening of national governmental and non-governmental capacities to address and manage different political challenges and contested issues in a sustainable and peaceful manner. Strengthening of national mechanisms for consensus-building, institutional strengthening of conflict resolution capacities on local and national levels, and the development leadership capacities will be critical for this purpose.

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/samegrelo-prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Human Security and Social Integration Programme (HuSSIP)
Project starting date: 01 November, 2009
Project ending data: 31 October 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=114
Brief description : The programme modules are designed to mobilize wider positive benefits, encompassing non-IDP host communities, as well as addressing the larger social integration priorities of the government. In order to achieve this goal the programme has adopted the human security approach which is rooted in a multi-sectoral development philosophy and encompasses the following components: community participation, livelihoods and employment generation, access to justice, public awareness and confidence building and reconciliation. Key words: internally displaced people, gender, access to basic services, human security, justice.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 3,598,475.00
Funding Partners: Norway: 3,138,522USD City of Poti: 38,739USD Khobi self-governmnet: 40,446USD Tsalenjiha self-government: 34,589OSD Senaki self-government: 46,178USD UNDP: 300,000USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Legal Advice Service; Zugdidi University; Poti Vocational Center
Number of project staff : 6
Name of the location (region/district, village): Tsalenjikha Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 5600 people (incl 2392 IDPs) benefited from legal assistance; 3283 people of all ages (incl 1062 IDPs) received civic education training; 63 staff members of 5 Municipal Social units (Khobi, Tslanejiha, Zugdidi, Poti, Senaki); 815 school children, students and teachers (incl 350 IDPs) of Tsalenjiha and Zugdidi municipalities benefited from civic education program; 2092 farmers (incl 380 IDPs) benefited from reducing damaging effects of American White Butterfly on their crops
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Legal Advice Service; Zugdidi University; Poti Vocational Center
Contact person : Nils Christensen Crisis Prevention and Recovery Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/samegrelo-prodoc.pdf

Number of beneficiaries: 5600 people (incl 2392 IDPs) benefited from legal assistance; 3283 people of all ages (incl 1062 IDPs) received civic education training; 63 staff members of 5 Municipal Social units (Khobi, Tslanejiha, Zugdidi, Poti, Senaki); 815 school children, students and teachers (incl 350 IDPs) of Tsalenjiha and Zugdidi municipalities benefited from civic education program; 2092 farmers (incl 380 IDPs) benefited from reducing damaging effects of American White Butterfly on their crops
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Legal Advice Service; Zugdidi University; Poti Vocational Center
Contact person : Nils Christensen Crisis Prevention and Recovery Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/samegrelo-prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Human Security and Social Integration Programme (HuSSIP)
Project starting date: 01 November, 2009
Project ending data: 31 October 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=114
Brief description : The programme modules are designed to mobilize wider positive benefits, encompassing non-IDP host communities, as well as addressing the larger social integration priorities of the government. In order to achieve this goal the programme has adopted the human security approach which is rooted in a multi-sectoral development philosophy and encompasses the following components: community participation, livelihoods and employment generation, access to justice, public awareness and confidence building and reconciliation. Key words: internally displaced people, gender, access to basic services, human security, justice.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 3,598,475.00
Funding Partners: Norway: 3,138,522USD City of Poti: 38,739USD Khobi self-governmnet: 40,446USD Tsalenjiha self-government: 34,589OSD Senaki self-government: 46,178USD UNDP: 300,000USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Legal Advice Service; Zugdidi University; Poti Vocational Center
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Khobi Municipality
Number of beneficiaries: 5600 people (incl 2392 IDPs) benefited from legal assistance; 3283 people of all ages (incl 1062 IDPs) received civic education training; 63 staff members of 5 Municipal Social units (Khobi, Tslanejiha, Zugdidi, Poti, Senaki); 815 school children, students and teachers (incl 350 IDPs) of Tsalenjiha and Zugdidi municipalities benefited from civic education program; 2092 farmers (incl 380 IDPs) benefited from reducing damaging effects of American White Butterfly on their crops
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Legal Advice Service; Zugdidi University; Poti Vocational Center
Contact person : Nils Christensen Crisis Prevention and Recovery Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/samegrelo-prodoc.pdf

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.ge/files/project_files/prodoc-vulnerability.pdf
Project Name : Assessment of Social Vulnerability in Georgia
Project starting date: 15 February, 2011
Project ending data: 30 June 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.ge/index.php?lang_id=ENG&sec_id=40&pr_id=157
Brief description : The project aims at providing a comprehensive baseline analysis of the social vulnerability status of the population in Georgia with specific emphasis on three groups: internally displaced persons (IDPs), persons with disabilities, and high mountainous population. The project includes three activities: A nationally representative survey with boosters of the three population groups; Qualitative data collection through in-depth interviews and focus groups before and after the survey implementation, as well as secondary data collection on key socio-economic indicators at local level (sampling units); and analysis of social vulnerability pattern. Key words: democracy, social vulnerable status, disabilities, displaced persons, gender, poverty reduction.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 200,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): GEOSTAT
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): City of Tbilisi
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Statisticians, policy-makers
Contact person : Natia Natsvlishvili Democratic Governance Team Leader registry.ge@undp.org www.undp.org.ge www.facebook.com/UNDPGeorgia Tel.: +(995 32) 2251126 Fax: +(995 32) 225027
Country: Georgia
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Poverty Reduction Programme (2012-2016)
Project starting date: January 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2016
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1871-poverty-reduction
Brief description : The project aims at complementing the efforts of the government and civil society in poverty alleviation by enhancing economic opportunities for vulnerable groups (women, youth and the poor), supporting income-generating activity and providing access to financial services as well as gender issues.

Number of project staff : 11

Number of beneficiaries: Indirect-3600 overall in the country
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Ms. Nuria Choibaeva, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg , +996 777 93 50 93
Country: Kyrgyzstan

Name of the location (region/district, village): Naryn, Eki Naryn,
Number of beneficiaries: Naryn-153
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Ms. Nuria Choibaeva, Progamme and Policy Analyst, roza.choibaeva@undp.org, +996 777 93 50 93

Project Name : Poverty Reduction Programme (2012-2016)
Project starting date: January 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2016
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1871-poverty-reduction
Brief description : The project aims at complementing the efforts of the government and civil society in poverty alleviation by enhancing economic opportunities for vulnerable groups (women, youth and the poor), supporting income-generating activity and providing access to financial services.

Project Name : Wider Europe: Aid For Trade for Central Asia, Caucasus and Western CIS
Project starting date: January 1, 2008
Project ending data: January 31, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1408-aid-for-trade
Brief description : Project is aimed at developing sustainable information-marketing system and its integration in the international trade network; institutional development of competitiveness growth of export products of farmers organizations, business associations, small and medium-sized enterprises; development of business partnership and stimulation of development of remote sale channels.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 687,694.00
Funding Partners: The Government of Finland (USD 624,505) The Government of Luxembourg (USD 63,185)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Batken Province Administration
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Batken, Kadamjai
Number of beneficiaries: 2000 direct beneficiaries (members of pilot communities) and 4500 indirect beneficiaries
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Ms. Nuria Choibaeva, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg , +996 777 93 50 93
Country: Kyrgyzstan
Download Project Document :

Project Name : Wider Europe: Aid For Trade for Central Asia, Caucasus and Western CIS
Project starting date: January 1, 2008
Project ending data: January 31, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1408-aid-for-trade
Brief description : Project is aimed at developing sustainable information-marketing system and its integration in the international trade network; institutional development of competitiveness growth of export products of farmers organizations, business associations, small and medium-sized enterprises; development of business partnership and stimulation of development of remote sale channels.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 687,694.00
Funding Partners: The Government of Finland (USD 624,505) The Government of Luxembourg (USD 63,185)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Batken Province Administration
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Batken, Karajygach
Number of beneficiaries: 2000 direct beneficiaries (members of pilot communities) and 4500 indirect beneficiaries
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Ms. Nuria Choibaeva, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg , +996 777 93 50 93
Country: Kyrgyzstan

Project Name : DAO: Rehabilitation Riparian Forests of Kyrgyzstan
Project starting date: January 1, 2011
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1414-rehabilitation-riparian-forests-of-kyrgyzstan-27
Brief description : The project aims at strengthening systemic and institutional capacity for land friendly riparian forest management through demonstrating sustainable forestry that contribute to mitigation of land degradation and improving livelihoods, and ensuring awareness of local population and pupils about forest benefits, both in terms of ecological sustainability and disaster reduction and mitigation (against flooding, landslide, avalanches)
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 567,100.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($481,500) UNV ($85,600)
Implementing partners (both central and local): State Agency on Environment Protection and Forestry under the Government, Balykchy State Forest Management Unit, LSG, (30) Forest plot lessees, (4) CBOs, (3) secondary schools
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Issyk-Kul, Kok-Maynak
Number of beneficiaries: 3000
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mr. Daniar Ibragimov, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg, +996 772 55 04 50
Country: Kyrgyzstan
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Environment Protection for Sustainable Development Programme
Project starting date: August 1, 2011
Project ending data: December 31, 2016
Visit project website: http://www.caresd.net/
Brief description : The project aims at supporting and strengthen capacities of the state institutions and the civil society of the Kyrgyz Republic for integration of environmental sustainability and climate change resilience into pro-poor (socio-economic) development policies and programmes. The achievement of the above will be accomplished via efforts aimed at promoting approaches to low carbon devel-opment, sustainable natural resource management and support provided to facilitate transition to climate resilient economies via development of climate change adaptation strategies.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 10,196,790.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 1,096,790) Indicative RM target ($8,680,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): State Agency on Environment Protection and Forestry under the Government, Ministry of Economy and antimonopoly policy, Ministry of Agriculture and melioration, Ministry of Energy and industry, National Statistic Committee, NGOs, National Academy of Sciences
Number of project staff : 5
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kyrgyzstan, Bishkek
Number of beneficiaries: N/A
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mr. Daniar Ibragimov, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg, +996 772 55 04 50
Country: Kyrgyzstan

Project Name : DAO: Supply of Reliable Energy to Rural First Aid Stations
Project starting date: January 1, 2011
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1413-energy-first-aid-stations
Brief description : The project aims at improving the reliability of electricity supply to rural first aid Stations. The rural first aid station will be fitted with mini-hydro units and solar energy. It is done to demonstrate efficiency of use of renewable energy in remote areas.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy

Number of beneficiaries: 500

Project Name : Small Hydro Power Development
Project starting date: July 1, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1410-small-hydro-power-development
Brief description : The project is aimed at promoting market-driven approach for development of small hydro power within grid-based system in Kyrgyzstan. It will assist the state to lay out necessary conditions for investment and improve legal framework for mainstreaming small hydro power into general electricity grid.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 1,430,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF TF ($ 950,000) UNDP ($ 100,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Energy and Industry, Directorate for small and medium-scale power generation projects in KR, NGOs
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): 42.135672, 76.916247
Number of beneficiaries: 500
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mr. Daniar Ibragimov, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg, +996 772 55 04 50
Country: Kyrgyzstan

Project starting date: January 1, 2010
Project ending data: August 31, 2012

Brief description : The project aims at contributing the system, institutional, and individual capacities needed to respond to country barriers in terms of an inconsistent and divergent policy environment, inadequate and inefficient resources to combat SLM, gaps in human capital to develop SLM programs, and a disconnect between project level successes and policy making.

Project starting date: January 1, 2008

Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/895-energy-efficiency-in-buildings
Brief description : The project aims at reducing energy consumption and associated GHG emissions in Kyrgyzstan building sector by 30-40%.

Project Name : Promoting Integrated Water Resouce Management (IWRM) and Fostering Transboundary Dialogue in Central Asia
Project starting date: January 1, 2009
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1412-promoting-integrated-water-resouce-management-iwrm-and-fostering-transboundary-dialogue-in-central-asia
Brief description : This regional programme will build on successful experiences with introducing IWRM in Kazakhstan, and aims to promote transboundary dialogue and sustainable water resources management in Central Asia through interventions (i) at national level (mainly involving Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan), and (ii) at transboundary level (mainly involving Kazakhstan and China) in parallel.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 1,850,000.00

Project Name : Cessation of local transmission of malaria in the Kyrgyz Republic
Project starting date: January 1, 2011
Project ending data: December 31, 2013
Visit project website: to be included soon into the undp website
Brief description : The Programme will support the implementation of state programmes on Malaria and will help the national institutions to deliver a complex of comprehensive measures to cessation of local transmission and transition to elimination of malaria in Kyrgyzstan. UNDP in its role of the Principal Recipient of GF grants will be primarily focusing on strengthening and accelerating the state reforms, building national capacity for programme development and implementation by building the capacities of sub-recipients and communities as well as government and civil society organizations.

Project Name : Effective Disaster Risk Management for Sustainable Human Development and Security.
Project starting date: January, 2012
Project ending data: December, 2016
Visit project website: http://undp.akvoapp.org/en/project/679/
Brief description : The projcet aims at integrating Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) into sustainable development programming; strengthening regional cooperation and making DRR gender and age sensitive. Assist in shifting the focus of national and local DRR policies and practicies from post-disaster response and recovery to comprehensive disaster risk reduction which is synergetic with climate change, poverty reduction, good governance, gender equality and other interreklated dimensions, so to increase human security and safety.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 2,682,216.00
Funding Partners: UNDP $902,876 2012-2016 ($132,500 - 2012) BCPR $1,500,000 - 2012-2016. $500,000 - 2012. DAO $280,340 -2012)

Number of beneficiaries: 1100 community members (240 households)
Name of beneficiaries or organization : MES, LSG
Contact person : Mr. Daniar Ibragimov, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg, +996 772 55 04 50
Country: Kyrgyzstan

Assist in shifting the focus of national and local DRR policies and practicies from post-disaster response and recovery to comprehensive disaster risk reduction which is synergetic with climate change, poverty reduction, good governance, gender equality and other interreklated dimensions, so to increase human security and safety.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 2,682,216.00
Funding Partners: UNDP $902,876 2012-2016 ($132,500 - 2012) BCPR $1,500,000 - 2012-2016. $500,000 - 2012. DAO $280,340 -2012)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Emergency Situation of the KR; Local self-governance
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Osh, Kainama
Number of beneficiaries: 1383 community members (297 hoseholds)
Name of beneficiaries or organization : MES, LSG
Contact person : Mr. Daniar Ibragimov, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg, +996 772 55 04 50
Country: Kyrgyzstan
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Effective Disaster Risk Management for Sustainable Human Development and Security.
Project starting date: January, 2012
Project ending data: December, 2016
Visit project website: http://undp.akvoapp.org/en/project/679/
Brief description : The projcet aims at integrating Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) into sustainable development programming; strengthening regional cooperation and making DRR gender and age sensitive. Assist in shifting the focus of national and local DRR policies and practicies from post-disaster response and recovery to comprehensive disaster risk reduction which is synergetic with climate change, poverty reduction, good governance, gender equality and other interreklated dimensions, so to increase human security and safety.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy

Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Emergency Situation of the KR; Local self-governance
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Osh, Alay,Ayu-Topan
Number of beneficiaries: 1014 community members (187 hoseholds)
Name of beneficiaries or organization : MES, LSG
Contact person : Mr. Daniar Ibragimov, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg, +996 772 55 04 50

Project starting date: January, 2012
Project ending data: December, 2016
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/what-we-do/focus-areas/disaster-risk-management-and-environmental-protection
Brief description : The projcet aims at ntegrating Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) into sustainable development programming; strengthening regional cooperation and making DRR gender and age sensitive. Assist in shifting the focus of national and local DRR policies and practicies from post-disaster response and recovery to comprehensive disaster risk reduction which is synergetic with climate change, poverty reduction, good governance, gender equality and other interreklated dimensions, so to increase human security and safety.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 2,682,216.00
Funding Partners: UNDP $902,876 2012-2016 ($132,500 - 2012) BCPR $1,500,000 - 2012-2016. $500,000 - 2012. DAO $280,340 -2012)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Emergency Situation of the KR; Local self-governance
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Jalal-Abad, Kyzyl-Tokoy
Number of beneficiaries: 380 community members (80 households)
Name of beneficiaries or organization : MES, LSG
Contact person : Mr. Daniar Ibragimov, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg, +996 772 55 04 50
Country: Kyrgyzstan
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Poverty and Environment Initiative (PEI)
Project starting date: February, 2011
Project ending data: December, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/what-we-do/focus-areas/disaster-risk-management-and-environmental-protection
Brief description : The project aims at enhancing the contribution of environment to human well-being, pro-poor economic growth and achievement of the MDG. Integration of poverty-environemnt nexus into national, sub-national, sectoral and UN, UNDP development policy processes and documents - in order to improve environment sustainability and ensure pro-poor economic growth.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 970,000.00
Funding Partners: UNEP ($900,000) UNDP ($70,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Economy
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Bishkek
Number of beneficiaries: 11
Name of beneficiaries or organization : MoE
Contact person : Mr. Daniar Ibragimov, Progamme and Policy Analyst, registry.kg@undp.kg, +996 772 55 04 50
Country: Kyrgyzstan

Project Name : Operationalizing Good Governance for Social Justice
Project starting date: March 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1938-social-justice-project
Brief description : The project aims at increasing and rendering more equitable access to public services by repartition of benefits to vulnerable groups in three target groups (women, youth and children, with a strong consideration of minorities' representation) in approximately 30 selected municipalities, through improved local and national good governance processes
Thematic area : Democratic Governance

Project Name : Naryn Area Based Development Programme (2012-2016)
Project starting date: July 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2016
Visit project website:
Brief description : The goal of Project is to contribute to sustainable development based on communities empowered through community institutions to articulate and address their needs and priorities, and the local Government able to support community-based rural rehabilitation and development in an integrated, people-focused, inclusive and participatory manner, with close engagement of private sector at local level. The overall strategy is to introduce Area-based development approach and support the establishment of an integrated planning and implementation framework for a comprehensive (multi-sector, multi-level and multi-agency), coordinated, pro-poor and pro-growth approach to sustainable development at rayon and ayil-okmotyus’ levels.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 3,908,553.00
Funding Partners: AGFUND ($ 14 980) DAO ($ 47 902 ) UNEP ($ 170 000) PBF IRF ($ 33 181 ) TRAC ($112 214) EU ($13 182 ) BCPR ($ 10 793) The Government of Russian ($ 3 500 000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Naryn oblast state administration
Number of project staff : 6
Name of the location (region/district, village): Naryn
Number of beneficiaries: Direct-3177 overall in the oblast and 23800 indirect beneficiaries
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mr. Erkinbek Kasybekov, Assistant Resident Representative, registry.kg@undp.kg phone: +996-312-611211 ext. 129 (w.)
Country: Kyrgyzstan
Download Project Document :

Visit project website:
Brief description : The goal of Project is to contribute to sustainable development based on communities empowered through community institutions to articulate and address their needs and priorities, and the local Government able to support community-based rural rehabilitation and development in an integrated, people-focused, inclusive and participatory manner, with close engagement of private sector at local level. The overall strategy is to introduce Area-based development approach and support the establishment of an integrated planning and implementation framework for a comprehensive (multi-sector, multi-level and multi-agency), coordinated, pro-poor and pro-growth approach to sustainable development at rayon and ayil-okmotyus’ levels.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 3,908,553.00
Funding Partners: AGFUND ($ 14 980) DAO ($ 42 902 ) UNEP ($ 15 000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Naryn oblast state administration
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Echkibashy village, Naryn rayon, Naryn oblast
Number of beneficiaries: 62
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mr. Erkinbek Kasybekov, Assistant Resident Representative, registry.kg@undp.kg phone: +996-312-611211 ext. 129 (w.)
Country: Kyrgyzstan

Brief description : The project is aimed at reducing the impacts of natural disasters on the poor and vulnerable communities, in order to meet the following country's development strategy and the Millennium Development Goals, as well as reducing the vulnerability of local communities by increasing volunteerism and civic engagement in disaster risk management

Project Name : Osh Area Based Development Programme (2012-2016)
Project starting date: July 01, 2009
Project ending data: December 31, 2016
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/ru/component/resource/article/1-projects/871-peace-and-development-programme
Brief description : The project works to address root causes of conflicts and focuses on on strengthening social and political structures at all levels, as well as strengthening national capacity for peace in order to foster a "culture of peace" and to facilitate sustainable human development.

Brief description : The project aims at complementing the efforts of the government and civil society in poverty alleviation by enhancing economic opportunities for vulnerable groups (women, youth and the poor), supporting income-generating activity and providing access to financial services as well as gender issues.

Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1871-poverty-reduction
Brief description : The project aims at complementing the efforts of the government and civil society in poverty alleviation by enhancing economic opportunities for vulnerable groups (women, youth and the poor), supporting income-generating activity and providing access to financial services as well as gender issues.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance

Project Name : Osh Area Based Development Programme (2012-2016)
Project starting date: September 2012
Project ending data: December 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/en/resources/project-database/article/1-projects/1871-poverty-reduction
Brief description : The project seeks to complement the efforts of the government and civil society in poverty reduction by enhancing economic opportunities for vulnerable groups (women, youth and the poor), supporting income-generating activity and providing access to financial services. At the national level the programme promotes the priorities established by the governement and assisits in development and implementation of the plans and strategies which support economic and social development of the poor people. Discuss results of the Impact Assessment of the programme on beneficiaries (2011) with all stakeholders, including women NGOs.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 1,970.00
Funding Partners: AGFUND ( $17,397,67) TRAC ($1970,44)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Economic Affairs at the national level. At the local level, State Administration and LSG.
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Jalal-Abad oblast location coordinates :
Number of beneficiaries: 30 of participants, more than 600 direct and 2,000 indirect beneficiaries
Name of beneficiaries or organization :

Country: Kyrgyzstan

Project Name : Wider Europe: Aid for Trade for Central Asia, South Caucasus and Western CIS
Project starting date: November, 2009
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website:
Brief description : Project is aimed at development of sustainable information-marketing system and its integration in the international trade network; institutional development of competitiveness growth of export products of farmers organizations, business associations, small and medium-sized enterprises; development of business partnership; capacity building in trade development and promotion of products; stimulation of development of remote sale channels.

Project Name : The joint project of the EU and the UN "Promoting of good administration to reach social justice"
Project starting date: October 2011
Project ending data: October 2014
Visit project website:
Brief description : The project aims to consolidate the reforms and practices of good governance at all levels, civil society organizations and the private sector in poverty reduction, human rights and sustainable human development.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 6,951,269.10
Funding Partners: The European Union (EU), UNDP, UN Women, UNICEF, UNESCO
Implementing partners (both central and local): The implementing Agencies: UNDP, UNICEF, UNESCO and UN Women

Project Name : Disaster risk management programme
Project starting date: January 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2016
Visit project website: http://www.undp.kg/ru/what-we-do/focus-areas/disaster-risk-management-and-environmental-protection
Brief description : The project is aimed at reducing the impacts of natural disasters on the poor and vulnerable communities, in order to meet the following country's development strategy and the Millennium Development Goals, as well as reducing the vulnerability of local communities by increasing volunteerism and civic engagement in disaster risk management

Project Name : Enhancing Electoral System and Processes in Turkmenistan
Project starting date: 30 September, 2010
Project ending data: 31 May, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undptkm.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=694&Itemid=109
Brief description : This project supported the national-level developments, contributing towards genuine, credible and transparent election processes in Turkmenistan. The project assisted the government to: (i) review and amend the electoral legal framework in line with international standards and best practices; (ii) Improve administration of elections through a series of technical assistance trainings and other initiatives; and (iii) nurture a democratic culture through direct support of all actors of electoral process.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 278,354.00
Funding Partners: USAID ($ 260,000), UNDP ($18,354)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Central Commission for Elections and Referenda of Turkmenistan
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Turkmenistan, Ashgabat
Number of beneficiaries: N/A
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Central Commission for Elections and Referenda of Turkmenistan
Contact person : Begench Yazliyev, Programme Specialist, registry.tm@undp.org (+99312) 425250 (ext. 235)
Country: Turkmenistan

Project Name : Border Management Programme in Central Asia (BOMCA 8)
Project starting date: 1 July, 2011
Project ending data: 30 June, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undptkm.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=704&Itemid=107
Brief description : The project aims at promoting the stability and security of Central Asia countries through Integrated Border Management and Regional Cooperation. In Turkmenistan the project provides support to the national authorities in introducing more efficient procedures to facilitate legitimate cross-border trade. The project has the following three objectives (i) to help increase security in the Central Asian region, (ii) to contribute toward the facilitation of legitimate trade and transit and (iii) to reduce the illicit movement of goods and people.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,582,620.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 174,000) EU ($ 1,408,620)
Implementing partners (both central and local): State Coordination Committee on Fight against Drug Abuse at the Cabinet of Ministers of Turkmenistan; Turkmenistan State Border Service; Turkmenistan State Customs Service; Turkmenistan State Migration Service; Turkmenistan State Drugs Control Agency
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Turkmenistan, Ashgabat
Number of beneficiaries: N/A
Name of beneficiaries or organization : State Coordination Committee on Fight against Drug Abuse at the Cabinet of Ministers of Turkmenistan; Turkmenistan State Border Service; Turkmenistan State Customs Service; Turkmenistan State Migration Service; Turkmenistan State Drugs Control Agency
Contact person : Begench Yazliyev, Programme Specialist, registry.tm@undp.org (+99312) 425250 (ext. 235)
Country: Turkmenistan

Project Name : Improving Energy Efficiency in the Residential Building Sector of Turkmenistan
Project starting date: 01.06.2011
Project ending data: 31.03.2015
Visit project website: http://www.undptkm.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1257&Itemid=118
Brief description : The project aims at reducing greenhouse gas emissions by improving energy management and reducing energy consumption in the residential building sector in Turkmenistan. The project will strengthen incentives and capacity to build highly energy-efficient buildings, develop capacity of State Corporation "Turkmengas" to identify end-use energy savings in its housing stock and implement investments to reduce end-use energy consumption.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 46,203,280.00
Funding Partners: GEF ($2,516,280) UNDP ($300,000) TurkmenGas ($19,887,000) Ashgabat City ($17,500,000) Ministry of Construction ($6,000,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): State Corporation "Turkmengaz"
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Turkmenistan, Ashgabat
Number of beneficiaries: N/A
Name of beneficiaries or organization : State Corporation "Nebitgasgurlushyk"; Administration of Ashgabat city; Ministry of Construction; Ministry of Power Engineering; Ministry of Public Utilities
Contact person : Rovshen Nurmuhamedov, Programme Specialist, registry.tm@undp.org, (+99312) 425250 (ext. 333)
Country: Turkmenistan
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Addressing Climate Change Risks to Farming Systems in Turkmenistan at National and Community Level
Project starting date: 01.10.2011
Project ending data: 30.09.2016
Visit project website: http://www.undptkm.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1258&Itemid=119
Brief description : The main objective of the project is to strengthen water management practices at both local and national levels in response to climate change-induced water scarcity risks that are increasingly affecting farming systems in Turkmenistan. The project will assess and deliver concrete water adaptation measures to local vulnerable communities in three different agro-climatic regions such as Karakum (desert), Nohur (mountains) and Sakarchaga (oasis), while also strengthening the national water legislation and pricing to ensure water availability for local communities.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 2,929,500.00
Funding Partners: Adaptation FUND ($ 2,929,500)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Nature Protection of Turkmenistan
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Turkmenistan, Ashgabat
Number of beneficiaries: Over 1000 farmers
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Rovshen Nurmuhamedov, Programme Specialist, registry.tm@undp.org, (+99312) 425250 (ext. 333)
Country: Turkmenistan
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Addressing Climate Change Risks to Farming Systems in Turkmenistan at National and Community Level
Project starting date: 01.10.2011
Project ending data: 30.09.2016
Visit project website: http://www.undptkm.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1258&Itemid=119
Brief description : The main objective of the project is to strengthen water management practices at both local and national levels in response to climate change-induced water scarcity risks that are increasingly affecting farming systems in Turkmenistan. The project will assess and deliver concrete water adaptation measures to local vulnerable communities in three different agro-climatic regions such as Karakum (desert), Nohur (mountains) and Sakarchaga (oasis), while also strengthening the national water legislation and pricing to ensure water availability for local communities.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 2,929,500.00
Funding Partners: Adaptation FUND ($ 2,929,500)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Nature Protection of Turkmenistan
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Turkmenistan, Nokhur, Balkan

Download Project Document :
Project Name : Addressing Climate Change Risks to Farming Systems in Turkmenistan at National and Community Level
Project starting date: 01.10.2011
Project ending data: 30.09.2016
Visit project website: http://www.undptkm.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1258&Itemid=119
Brief description : The main objective of the project is to strengthen water management practices at both local and national levels in response to climate change-induced water scarcity risks that are increasingly affecting farming systems in Turkmenistan. The project will assess and deliver concrete water adaptation measures to local vulnerable communities in three different agro-climatic regions such as Karakum (desert), Nohur (mountains) and Sakarchaga (oasis), while also strengthening the national water legislation and pricing to ensure water availability for local communities.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 2,929,500.00
Funding Partners: Adaptation FUND ($ 2,929,500)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Nature Protection of Turkmenistan
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Turkmenistan, Karakum, Ahal
Number of beneficiaries: Over 1000 farmers
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Rovshen Nurmuhamedov, Programme Specialist, registry.tm@undp.org, (+99312) 425250
Country: Turkmenistan
