Project Name : Purposeful strengthening and expanding of qualified services on Tb diagnostics and treatment in Turkmenistan
Project starting date: 01.10.2010
Project ending data: 30.09.2015
Visit project website: http://www.undptkm.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=972&Itemid=117
Brief description : The project contributes to reducing the burden of tuberculosis in Turkmenistan by consolidating and expanding DOTS framework (short-course treatment of tuberculosis under the direct supervision of medical staff). This is being achieved through the introduction and scaling up of management of drug-resistant tuberculosis and strengthening of the health system performance for effective control of tuberculosis.

Project Name : PIMS 3674 Support to sustainable transport management in Dushanbe
Project starting date: May , 2010
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/environment-and-sustainable-development/84-support-to-sustainable-transport-management-in-dushanbe
Brief description : The project aims at reducing local and GHG emissions while improving access and quality of public transport services for all residents via: a) Enhancing vehicle efficiency and setting appropriate fuel quality standards; b) Improving the service quality of public transport, in particular trolleybuses; c) Increasing opportunities for non-motorized modes such as walking and biking; d) Developing integrated land-use/transport plans to reduce demand for travel; e) Enhancing municipal institutional transformation and governance structure to embrace sustainable transport.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 1,170,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF ($970.000,00) UNDP ($200.000,00)

Project Name : Technology Transfer
Project starting date: March, 2012
Project ending data: December 2015
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/environment-and-sustainable-development/83-technology-transfer-and-market-development-for-small-hydropower-in-tajikistan
Brief description : The project aimed to initiate UNDP Tajikistan's strategy's the scaling up of pilot activities for the acceleration of progress towards the achievement of MDGs with a particular focus on improving access to renewable energy in rural regions for the purpose of poverty reduction and triggering economic development. The project will significantly accelerate the development of small-scale hydropower (SHP) generation in Tajikistan by removing barriers through enabling legal and regulatory framework, capacity building and developing sustainable delivery models, thus substantially avoiding the use of conventional biomass and fossil fuels for power and other energy needs.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 3,330,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ( $ 1,330,000) GEF ($ 2,000,000)

Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-MSB_Eng.pdf
Project Name : Multi-Country project for sustainable land management capacity building
Project starting date: January 1, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/environment-and-sustainable-development/120-the-multi-country-capacity-building-mcb-project
Brief description : This project is an integrated Multi-country initiative within the CACILM CPP and is one of four related multi-country support projects under the CACILM Multi-country Framework Project (CMPF) by contributing the system, institutional, and individual capacities needed to respond to country barriers in terms of an inconsistent and divergent policy environment, inadequate and inefficient resources to combat SLM, gaps in human capital to develop SLM programs, and a disconnect between project level successes and policy making.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 372,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP Tajikistan
Number of project staff : 1

Number of beneficiaries: n/a

Brief description : This project is an integrated Multi-country initiative within the CACILM CPP and is one of four related multi-country support projects under the CACILM Multi-country Framework Project (CMPF) by contributing the system, institutional, and individual capacities needed to respond to country barriers in terms of an inconsistent and divergent policy environment, inadequate and inefficient resources to combat SLM, gaps in human capital to develop SLM programs, and a disconnect between project level successes and policy making.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 372,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP Tajikistan
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Gissar
Number of beneficiaries: n/a
Name of beneficiaries or organization : n/a
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-MSB_Eng.pdf
Project Name : Multi-Country project for sustainable land management capacity building
Project starting date: January 1, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/environment-and-sustainable-development/120-the-multi-country-capacity-building-mcb-project
Brief description : The project supports the CACs efforts to halt land degradation by enhancing the capability of each nation to execute their National Programming Frameworks. GEF support will result in (a) increased policy coherence; (b) resources effectively mobilized for SLM; (c) improved interaction between state agencies and land users through increased human resources; and (d) developed and strengthened learning, dissemination, and replication of best practices in collaborative SLM. Without this component project, the established multi-country and national support structures will not have the capacity for effective policy-making, planning, and financing SLM initiatives that will meet future challenges and changing land-use scenarios with new global challenges, such as the effects of global warming on agriculture and food systems.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 372,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP Tajikistan
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Tursunzoda
Number of beneficiaries: n/a
Name of beneficiaries or organization : n/a
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document :

Project starting date: April 2009
Project ending data: December 2012
Visit project website: http://www.amcu.gki.tj/
Brief description : The project aims at improving the professional and technical capacity of the Government to promote investment and strengthen national aid coordination mechanisms. Project outputs: - Provide core information services to government, donors and implementing organizations on aid flows; - Improve aid coordination and enhance aid effectiveness to support national ownership and ensure alignment of donors support on national development strategies; - Policy Advice and Coordination on Investment Promotion enhancing international economic cooperation between Tajikistan and countries with good practices in the area; - Generation of strategy / programs to promote FDI and providing regulatory and methodological support for the investment policy of selected regions and/or industries

Brief description : The overall goal of the project is to contribute to development of capacity for Corruption Prevention in Tajikistan. Key words: capacity building, corruption prevention, government
Thematic area : Democratic Governance

Project Name : Mainstreaming Human Development in Tajikistan
Project starting date: May, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website:
Brief description : The project aims at promoting the Human Development concept at all levels including the decision-making level, where it will be acknowledged and recognized as a basis and the main criteria in the social dialogue and in the formulation of the national socio-economic policies in Tajikistan.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 590,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 590,000)

Project Name : Border Management Northern Afghanistan (BOMNAF)
Project starting date: December 13, 2010
Project ending data: December 13, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/good-governance/61-bomnaf
Brief description : The project aims at reinforcing border management capacity and trans-border cooperation in the Northern Provinces of Afghanistan. The project intends to improve cross border cooperation, the capacity to reduce crime and improve legal trade, travel and commerce along Afghanistan's border with Tajikistan and Uzbekistan.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 10,746,053.00
Funding Partners: EU ($ 10,746,053)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Government of Afghanistan, Government of Tajikistan including both Ministries of Interior, Ministries of Finance and Ministries of Foreign Affairs, European Commission, UNODC, Tajik Border Force, Afghan Border Police, Customs Agencies
Number of project staff : 11
Name of the location (region/district, village): Dushanbe
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Around 1500 Afghan Border Police and Afhgan Customs Department personnel
Contact person : Yokubjon Abdukholikov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 261)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/PAR-IS_Project%20Document__FINAL_ENG_80911.pdf
Project Name : Public Administration Reform/Institutional Strengthening*
Project starting date: September, 2011
Project ending data: September, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/good-governance/57-public-administration-reforminstitutional-strengthening
Brief description : The project aims at identifying the strategic mandate, current institutional gaps that hinder delivery, and a capacity development plan that includes staff development along with improvements to the enabling environment and organisational design. The aim is to build a lasting institutional legacy in critical and linked areas.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance

Project Name : Strengthening Tuberculosis Prevention and Control Program in the Framework of Health System Reform in the Republic of Tajikistan
Project starting date: October 1, 2009
Project ending data: September 30, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/hivaids/59-tb-control-project
Brief description : The overall goal of the project is to reduce the burden of TB in the Republic of Tajikistan by 2015 in line with the MDGs and Stop TB Partnership targets, aiming at strengthening TB prevention and control programme in the framework of health system reform. The indicators will be achieved through implementation of 7 grant objectives: (1) Ensure high quality DOTS expansion and enhancement actions; (2) Address TB/HIV, MDR and other challenges of the National TB Program (NTP); (3) Practical approach to lung diseases; (4) Engage all care providers in the NTP; (5) Empower people with TB and communities; (6) Operational research; and (7) Health system strengthening.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 6,842,027.00
Funding Partners: GFATM
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Health, Republican TB Control Centre, Republican TB Clinic Hospital, Department of Penitentiary Affairs, Ministry of Justice, Tajik Post Graduate Institute, CSOs
Number of project staff : 8
Name of the location (region/district, village): Sughd
Number of beneficiaries: n/a
Name of beneficiaries or organization : n/a
Contact person : Zebo Jalilova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 178)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc_TB_Prevention_R8_Ph2_eng.pdf

Project Name : Malaria Elimination
Project starting date: October 1, 2009
Project ending data: September 30, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/hivaids/58-malaria-elimination
Brief description : The overall goal of the project is to eliminate malaria infection through interruption of local malaria transmission. The proposed project is aimed at consolidating the achieved results of the ongoing reduction of Malaria infection. The project will scale up existing efforts of the malaria surveillance system, strengthening NCMP capacity, improving early detection and effective treatment as well as promotion of integrated vector control management. The general population in 41 project districts of the country will be targeted by the grant.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 3,340,700.00
Funding Partners: GFATM
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Health, Republican Centre to Fight Tropical Diseases, Republican Center for formation of healthy life style, Republican Center of Preventive Desinfection, PO "Subhi Tandurusti", World Health Organization
Number of project staff : 4
Name of the location (region/district, village): Sughd
Number of beneficiaries: 1130000

Project Name : Strengthening the supportive environment and scaling up prevention, treatment and care to contain HIV epidemic in the Republic of Tajikistan
Project starting date: October 1, 2009
Project ending data: 30-Sep-14
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/hivaids/60-hivaids-control-project
Brief description : The project aims at providing universal access to HIV services and laying the foundation for stabilizing the country’s epidemic. It is also intended to contribute to national health care reform through building and improving technical and managerial capacities of health professionals, promote participation of civil society in the response to the epidemic, and enhance the cooperation of NGOs with the public health sector. The current HIV/AIDS project will continue supporting a variety of service delivery points for IDUs, SWs, prisoners, ex-inmates, migrants, vulnerable women and other high-risk groups. It is also the only source of funding for (i) strengthening VCT services in the country, (ii) expanding the program to prevent the transmission of HIV from mother-to-child, (iii) improving the system of monitoring and evaluation, (iv) and providing treatment for ARV therapy and opportunistic infections.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 15,638,846.00
Funding Partners: GFATM
Implementing partners (both central and local): Central Military Hospital of MoD
Number of project staff : 7
Name of the location (region/district, village): Countrywide
Number of beneficiaries: uniformed staff
Name of beneficiaries or organization : MoD, MIA, State Border Guards, National Guards, National Security Committee
Contact person : Zebo Jalilova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 178)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc_HIV-Epidemic_R8_Ph2_eng.pdf

Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Population
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Hamadoni, Tajikistan
Number of beneficiaries: Labour migrants and vulnerable women
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Labour departments of local khukumats
Contact person : Zebo Jalilova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 178)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc_HIV-Epidemic_R8_Ph2_eng.pdf
Project Name : Strengthening the supportive environment and scaling up prevention, treatment and care to contain HIV epidemic in the Republic of Tajikistan
Project starting date: October 1, 2009
Project ending data: 30-Sep-14
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/hivaids/60-hivaids-control-project
Brief description : The project aims at providing universal access to HIV services and laying the foundation for stabilizing the country’s epidemic. It is also intended to contribute to national health care reform through building and improving technical and managerial capacities of health professionals, promote participation of civil society in the response to the epidemic, and enhance the cooperation of NGOs with the public health sector. The current HIV/AIDS project will continue supporting a variety of service delivery points for IDUs, SWs, prisoners, ex-inmates, migrants, vulnerable women and other high-risk groups. It is also the only source of funding for (i) strengthening VCT services in the country, (ii) expanding the program to prevent the transmission of HIV from mother-to-child, (iii) improving the system of monitoring and evaluation, (iv) and providing treatment for ARV therapy and opportunistic infections.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 15,638,846.00
Funding Partners: GFATM
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Population
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Shaartuz, Tajikistan
Number of beneficiaries: Labour migrants and vulnerable women
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Labour departments of local khukumats
Contact person : Zebo Jalilova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 178)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc_HIV-Epidemic_R8_Ph2_eng.pdf

Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kulob, Tajikistan
Number of beneficiaries: pregnant women, schoolchildren, vulnerable youth
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Health, Ministry of Education
Contact person : Zebo Jalilova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 178)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc_HIV-Epidemic_R8_Ph2_eng.pdf
Project Name : Strengthening the supportive environment and scaling up prevention, treatment and care to contain HIV epidemic in the Republic of Tajikistan
Project starting date: October 1, 2009
Project ending data: 30-Sep-14
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/hivaids/60-hivaids-control-project
Brief description : The project aims at providing universal access to HIV services and laying the foundation for stabilizing the country’s epidemic. It is also intended to contribute to national health care reform through building and improving technical and managerial capacities of health professionals, promote participation of civil society in the response to the epidemic, and enhance the cooperation of NGOs with the public health sector. The current HIV/AIDS project will continue supporting a variety of service delivery points for IDUs, SWs, prisoners, ex-inmates, migrants, vulnerable women and other high-risk groups. It is also the only source of funding for (i) strengthening VCT services in the country, (ii) expanding the program to prevent the transmission of HIV from mother-to-child, (iii) improving the system of monitoring and evaluation, (iv) and providing treatment for ARV therapy and opportunistic infections.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 15,638,846.00
Funding Partners: GFATM
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNICEF
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kurgan-Tube, Tajikistan
Number of beneficiaries: pregnant women, schoolchildren, vulnerable youth
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Health, Ministry of Education
Contact person : Zebo Jalilova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 178)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc_HIV-Epidemic_R8_Ph2_eng.pdf

Project Name : Support to Implementation of UNDP HIV, TB and Malaria control Program
Project starting date: January 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: n/a
Brief description : The project aims at providing universal access to HIV services and laying the foundation for stabilizing the country’s epidemic. It is also intended to contribute to national health care reform through building and improving technical and managerial capacities of health professionals, promote participation of civil society in the response to the epidemic, and enhance the cooperation of NGOs with the public health sector. The current HIV/AIDS project will continue supporting a variety of service delivery points for IDUs, SWs, prisoners, ex-inmates, migrants, vulnerable women and other high-risk groups. It is also the only source of funding for (i) strengthening VCT services in the country, (ii) expanding the program to prevent the transmission of HIV from mother-to-child, (iii) improving the system of monitoring and evaluation, (iv) and providing treatment for ARV therapy and opportunistic infections.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 254,500.00

Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Support to Implementation of UNDP HIV, TB and Malaria control Program
Project starting date: January 1, 2012
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: n/a
Brief description : The project aims at providing universal access to HIV services and laying the foundation for stabilizing the country’s epidemic. It is also intended to contribute to national health care reform through building and improving technical and managerial capacities of health professionals, promote participation of civil society in the response to the epidemic, and enhance the cooperation of NGOs with the public health sector. The current HIV/AIDS project will continue supporting a variety of service delivery points for IDUs, SWs, prisoners, ex-inmates, migrants, vulnerable women and other high-risk groups. It is also the only source of funding for (i) strengthening VCT services in the country, (ii) expanding the program to prevent the transmission of HIV from mother-to-child, (iii) improving the system of monitoring and evaluation, (iv) and providing treatment for ARV therapy and opportunistic infections.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 254,500.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Health, Republican TB Control Centre, Republican AIDS Centre, Republican Centre to Fight Tropical Diseases
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Gorno-Badakhshan
Number of beneficiaries: n/a
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Zebo Jalilova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 178)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document :

Download Project Document :
Project Name : UN Joint Advocacy Project on HIV
Project starting date: Jan-12
Project ending data: Dec-13
Visit project website: n/a
Brief description : The main goal of the proposed UN JAP in 2012-2013 is to expand and to coordinate UN technical support to improve national capacity on HIV programmes and contributed to national priorities in HIV prevention, treatment care and support to achieve mid-term targets of MDG 6. The key objectives of the project are strengthening the implementation of UN Joint Programme for Support to address country needs on HIV, enhance the national capacity on advocacy, strategic information and management for effective implementation of the programmes, tracking epidemic and response as well as reducing stigma and discrimination towards PLHIV, promotion of human rights and gender equality.
Thematic area : Responding to HIV/AIDS
Icon name: small_purple
Total budget (USD): 446,180.00
Funding Partners: for 2012-13: UNDP-$100,000; UNICEF-$40,000; UNFPA-$40,000, UNAIDS-$266,180
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNJAP
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Dushanbe
Number of beneficiaries: n/a
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Zebo Jalilova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 178)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-PEI.pdf
Project Name : Poverty and Environment Initiative
Project starting date: May, 2010
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/63-pei
Brief description : The project aims at enhancing capacity of government and other national and sub-national stakeholders to integrate environment into sustainable pro-poor development planning and budgeting. Key entry points for poverty-environment mainstreaming are district level planning and budgeting processes in line with supporting the implementation of the third Poverty Reduction Strategy.

Project Name : Tajik-Afghan Poverty Reduction Initiative (TAPRI)
Project starting date: March 2011
Project ending data: March, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/69-tapri
Brief description : The project will work to reduce poverty and build local capacity by developing cross-border cooperation between southern Tajikistan and northern Afghanistan, contributing to regional development, conflict mitigation, conflict prevention and enhanced human security as well as to examine, enhance and expand economic development in targeted communities, on both sides of the border to encourage socioeconomic integration between Afghanistan and Tajikistan.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 5,000,000.00
Funding Partners: Govt. of Japan ($ 5,000,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): ACTED, CESVI, Children Legal Center, Cristian Aid / ACT Central Asia, GEF / Smal Grants programme, Mission East, UNDP as Implementing agency, WFP.
Number of project staff : 30
Name of the location (region/district, village): Khatlon
Number of beneficiaries: 145777 (73278 are women)
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/Prodoc-TAPRI.pdf

Project Name : Goal Wash/Human Rights Based Approach Water Rights and Responsibilities Awareness Campaign
Project starting date: July, 2010
Project ending data: March , 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/64-goal-wash-hrba
Brief description : The country level aim of the project is to assist selected jamoats (local municipalities) to meet their responsibilities in the provision of safe and reliable water services through the design and implementation of a participative awareness campaign, in the context of a human rights based approach to water governance.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 203,000.00
Funding Partners: SIDA ($ 203,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Land Reclamation and Water Resources and Local hukumats
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Sughd
Number of beneficiaries: Total number for region: 39664
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc_Goal%20Wash.pdf
Project Name : Goal Wash/Human Rights Based Approach Water Rights and Responsibilities Awareness Campaign
Project starting date: July, 2010
Project ending data: March , 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/64-goal-wash-hrba
Brief description : The country level aim of the project is to assist selected jamoats (local municipalities) to meet their responsibilities in the provision of safe and reliable water services through the design and implementation of a participative awareness campaign, in the context of a human rights based approach to water governance.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 203,000.00
Funding Partners: SIDA ($ 203,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Land Reclamation and Water Resources and Local hukumats
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Ayni, Ayni
Number of beneficiaries: Total number for region: 39664
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan

Project Name : Scale up of Comprehensive Local Economic Development initiative
Project starting date: 2011
Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/68-support-to-led-initiatives-in-khatlon
Brief description : The main objective is facilitate local economic development processes and collaboration of public and private sectors. One of the anticipated results of LED exercise is changing attitudes and behaviors of both government and private sectors in terms of roles and responsibilities and finding better opportunities for real partnership.

Project Name : Providing market-demanded professional skills for rural poor
Project starting date: March 1, 2012
Project ending data: March 31, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/66-providing-market-demanded-professional-skills-for-rural-poor
Brief description : The project aims to improve better livelihoods for TB patients initiative and to improve access of TB affected families to income through micro-loan with favorable terms and conditions and vocational training. The initiative aims to achieve the following key outcomes: (1) Improved access of TB patients' families to favorable loans and (2) Improved access of TB patients' families to business and agriculture development skills.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 160,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 160,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Modular Training Center under the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection; Micro-Loan Organization "Rushdi Vose"
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Dushanbe
Number of beneficiaries: 1,091 (432 women)
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/Prodoc-Providing_market-demanded_professional_skills.pdf

Project Name : Enabling activities to support to National Preparations to the United Nations Conference on sustainable Development (RIO+20)
Project starting date: Thursday, March 15, 2012
Project ending data: Monday, December 31, 2012
Visit project website: n/a
Brief description : The main objective of the project is to provide an enabling framework to support the national preparations to the United Nations Conference on sustainable Development (RIO+20), namely to ensure the participation of the Tajikistan delegation in Rio+20 and relevant preparatory sessions, events and the conference itself as well as to support the development and publication of the preparatory materials.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 140,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP
Number of project staff : 2

Number of beneficiaries: n/a

Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-RGP.pdf
Project Name : Rural Growth Programme in Sughd region of Tadjikistan
Project starting date: January 1, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/67-rgp
Brief description : The project aims at enhancing more inclusive economic development in rural areas of Tajikistan in support of National Development Strategy and Poverty Reduction Strategy. The purpose of the RGP is to improve the local environment for economic growth, income generation and employment creation in Sughd region, northern Tajikistan. Note that this line only reflects the UNDP implemented activities. RGP is in fact a bigger programme with a total budget of USD 18.7M, implemented in partnership with GIZ, which is also contributing to its budget.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 10,853,026.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 3,000,000) DFID ($7,853,026)
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP CP (Dushanbe and Ayni and Khujand Aos), IOM, MEDT Planning Team
Number of project staff : 53
Name of the location (region/district, village): Navobod
Number of beneficiaries: 803
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-RGP.pdf

Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP CP (Dushanbe and Ayni and Khujand Aos), IOM, MEDT Planning Team
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Gusar
Number of beneficiaries: 610
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-RGP.pdf
Project Name : Rural Growth Programme in Sughd region of Tadjikistan
Project starting date: January 1, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/67-rgp
Brief description : The project aims at enhancing more inclusive economic development in rural areas of Tajikistan in support of National Development Strategy and Poverty Reduction Strategy. The purpose of the RGP is to improve the local environment for economic growth, income generation and employment creation in Sughd region, northern Tajikistan. Note that this line only reflects the UNDP implemented activities. RGP is in fact a bigger programme with a total budget of USD 18.7M, implemented in partnership with GIZ, which is also contributing to its budget.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 10,853,026.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 3,000,000) DFID ($7,853,026)
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP CP (Dushanbe and Ayni and Khujand Aos), IOM, MEDT Planning Team
Number of project staff :

Number of beneficiaries: 682

Country: Tajikistan

Project Name : Rural Growth Programme in Sughd region of Tadjikistan
Project starting date: January 1, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/67-rgp
Brief description : The project aims at enhancing more inclusive economic development in rural areas of Tajikistan in support of National Development Strategy and Poverty Reduction Strategy. The purpose of the RGP is to improve the local environment for economic growth, income generation and employment creation in Sughd region, northern Tajikistan. Note that this line only reflects the UNDP implemented activities. RGP is in fact a bigger programme with a total budget of USD 18.7M, implemented in partnership with GIZ, which is also contributing to its budget.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 10,853,026.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 3,000,000) DFID ($7,853,026)
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP CP (Dushanbe and Ayni and Khujand Aos), IOM, MEDT Planning Team
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Navgilem
Number of beneficiaries: 1,394
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-RGP.pdf

Download Project Document :
Project Name : Capacity building for mitigation of climate change induced disaster risks
Project starting date: November 2010
Project ending data: December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/crisis-prevention-a-recovery/77-drmp
Brief description : The Project focuses on the promotion, policy development, planning, contextualizing and system development for early recovery and climate risk management, with actual field-level implementation of recovery projects and mainstreaming of Disaster Risk Reduction into humanitarian and development activities, with specific attention to gender issues.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 1,800,144.00
Funding Partners: UNDP BCPR ($1,800,144)
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP
Number of project staff : 9
Name of the location (region/district, village): Rasht, Tajikistan
Number of beneficiaries: N/A
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)

Download Project Document :
Project Name : Capacity building for mitigation of climate change induced disaster risks
Project starting date: November 2010
Project ending data: December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/crisis-prevention-a-recovery/77-drmp
Brief description : The Project focuses on the promotion, policy development, planning, contextualizing and system development for early recovery and climate risk management, with actual field-level implementation of recovery projects and mainstreaming of Disaster Risk Reduction into humanitarian and development activities, with specific attention to gender issues.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 1,800,144.00
Funding Partners: UNDP BCPR ($1,800,144)
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Province
Number of beneficiaries: N/A
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-RGP.pdf
Project Name : Rural Growth Programme in Sughd region of Tadjikistan
Project starting date: January 1, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/67-rgp
Brief description : The project aims at enhancing more inclusive economic development in rural areas of Tajikistan in support of National Development Strategy and Poverty Reduction Strategy. The purpose of the RGP is to improve the local environment for economic growth, income generation and employment creation in Sughd region, northern Tajikistan. Note that this line only reflects the UNDP implemented activities. RGP is in fact a bigger programme with a total budget of USD 18.7M, implemented in partnership with GIZ, which is also contributing to its budget.

Project Name : Tajik-Afghan Poverty Reduction Initiative (TAPRI)
Project starting date: March 2011
Project ending data: March, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/69-tapri
Brief description : The project will work to reduce poverty and build local capacity by developing cross-border cooperation between southern Tajikistan and northern Afghanistan, contributing to regional development, conflict mitigation, conflict prevention and enhanced human security as well as to examine, enhance and expand economic development in targeted communities, on both sides of the border to encourage socioeconomic integration between Afghanistan and Tajikistan.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 5,000,000.00
Funding Partners: Govt. of Japan ($ 5,000,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): ACTED, CESVI, Children Legal Center, Cristian Aid / ACT Central Asia, GEF / Smal Grants programme, Mission East, UNDP as Implementing agency, WFP.
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kumsangir
Number of beneficiaries: total number in Khatlon region 145777 (73278 are women)
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan

Project Name : Border Management in Central Asia (BOMCA)
Project starting date: July 1, 2011
Project ending data: June 30, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/good-governance/62-bomca
Brief description : The project aims at promoting the stability and security of the Central Asian countries, assisting in their pursuit of sustainable economic development and poverty reduction and facilitating closer regional cooperation both within Central Asia and between Central Asia and the EU.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 2,400,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 240,000) EU ($ 2,160,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Tajik Border Guards, Customs Service, Drug Control Agency, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Agriculture, Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
Number of project staff : 6
Name of the location (region/district, village): Sogd, Tajikistan
Number of beneficiaries: 15-20
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Yokubjon Abdukholikov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 261)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-RGP.pdf
Project Name : Rural Growth Programme in Sughd region of Tadjikistan
Project starting date: January 1, 2010
Project ending data: December 31, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/67-rgp
Brief description : The project aims at enhancing more inclusive economic development in rural areas of Tajikistan in support of National Development Strategy and Poverty Reduction Strategy. The purpose of the RGP is to improve the local environment for economic growth, income generation and employment creation in Sughd region, northern Tajikistan. Note that this line only reflects the UNDP implemented activities. RGP is in fact a bigger programme with a total budget of USD 18.7M, implemented in partnership with GIZ, which is also contributing to its budget.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 10,853,026.00
Funding Partners: UNDP ($ 3,000,000) DFID ($7,853,026)
Implementing partners (both central and local): UNDP CP (Dushanbe and Ayni and Khujand Aos), IOM, MEDT Planning Team
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): 40.47, 69.92
Number of beneficiaries: 1,650
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/Prodoc-TAPRI.pdf
Project Name : Tajik-Afghan Poverty Reduction Initiative (TAPRI)
Project starting date: March 2011
Project ending data: March, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/site/index.php/en/our-programme/poverty-reduction/69-tapri
Brief description : The project will work to reduce poverty and build local capacity by developing cross-border cooperation between southern Tajikistan and northern Afghanistan, contributing to regional development, conflict mitigation, conflict prevention and enhanced human security as well as to examine, enhance and expand economic development in targeted communities, on both sides of the border to encourage socioeconomic integration between Afghanistan and Tajikistan.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 5,000,000.00
Funding Partners: Govt. of Japan ($ 5,000,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): ACTED, CESVI, Children Legal Center, Cristian Aid / ACT Central Asia, GEF / Smal Grants programme, Mission East, UNDP as Implementing agency, WFP.
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Pyanj, Tajikistan
Number of beneficiaries: total number in Khatlon region 145777 (73278 are women)
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Mubin Rustamov, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 142)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/ProDoc-RGP.pdf

Project Name : Support to Tajikistan Mine Action Programme
Project starting date: 2010
Project ending data: 2012

Brief description : The project aims at eliminating the economic and health impact of mine/UXO in Tajikistan. Clearing mine/UXO contaminated areas surely increased access to valuable arable land and reduced poverty among rural communities.

Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=314&Itemid=127
Brief description : The project aims at eliminating the economic and health impact of mine/UXO in Tajikistan. Clearing mine/UXO contaminated areas surely increased access to valuable arable land and reduced poverty among rural communities.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 2,841,632.00
Funding Partners: DFID UK ($253,969), UNMAS ($154,386), DFAIT ($1,511,496), UNDP ($921,781)
Implementing partners (both central and local): TMAC, Ministry of labour and social protection, Ministry of Health, NGOs working with landmine survivors, Society and National Union of PWDs, RCST, ICRC, HI, NOC
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Khatlon
Number of beneficiaries: Direct Bens: 110
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.tj/files/project_library/TMAC_ProDoc_2010-2012_eng.pdf

Project Name : Support to Tajikistan Mine Action Programme
Project starting date: 2010
Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.tj/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=314&Itemid=127
Brief description : The project aims at eliminating the economic and health impact of mine/UXO in Tajikistan. Clearing mine/UXO contaminated areas surely increased access to valuable arable land and reduced poverty among rural communities.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 2,841,632.00
Funding Partners: DFID UK ($253,969), UNMAS ($154,386), DFAIT ($1,511,496), UNDP ($921,781)
Implementing partners (both central and local): CHIIL, TMAC
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Khatlon
Number of beneficiaries: 22 TMAC staff 450,000 population of the under risk communities
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Catalyzing Capacities for Mine Action in Tajikistan and Going Beyond to Development
Project starting date: 2011
Project ending data: 2013
Visit project website:
Brief description : The project aims to further develop national institutional and operational capacity in order to ensure that the Government strategic commitments on meeting its obligations as a State Party to the Anti-personnel Mine Ban Convention, including those relating to article 5 (Clearance of mined land), are reached. The purpose of this project is to contribute to on-going UNDP “Support to Tajikistan Mine Action” Program through catalysing national capacities in the fields of coordination, quality assurance and quality control, EOD issues, VA and MRE and further promotion of linking mine action with development programs. The project aimed at supporting management capacities of the Tajik mine action Centre for quality control of the demining operations and efficiency and effectiveness of the survey and clearance activities.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 999,910.00
Funding Partners: BCPR ($999,910)
Implementing partners (both central and local): TMAC, Ministry of Defence, CoES, Border Forces, National Guard, FSD, NPA, UST.
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Panj
Number of beneficiaries: Eprox. 11,798 direct population
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document :

Project ending data: 2013

Number of beneficiaries: Direct Bens: 115
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Catalyzing Capacities for Mine Action in Tajikistan and Going Beyond to Development
Project starting date: 2011
Project ending data: 2013
Visit project website:
Brief description : The project aims to further develop national institutional and operational capacity in order to ensure that the Government strategic commitments on meeting its obligations as a State Party to the Anti-personnel Mine Ban Convention, including those relating to article 5 (Clearance of mined land), are reached. The purpose of this project is to contribute to on-going UNDP “Support to Tajikistan Mine Action” Program through catalysing national capacities in the fields of coordination, quality assurance and quality control, EOD issues, VA and MRE and further promotion of linking mine action with development programs. The project aimed at supporting management capacities of the Tajik mine action Centre for quality control of the demining operations and efficiency and effectiveness of the survey and clearance activities.
Thematic area : Crisis Prevention and Recovery
Icon name: small_blue
Total budget (USD): 999,910.00
Funding Partners: BCPR ($999,910)
Implementing partners (both central and local): TMAC, Ministry of labour and social protection, Ministry of Health, NGOs working with landmine survivors, Society and National Union of PWDs, RCST, ICRC, HI, NOC
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Rasht
Number of beneficiaries: Direct Bens:55
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Nargizakhon Usmanova, Programme Analyst, registry.tj@undp.org, (+992 44) 600 55 96 (ext. 118)
Country: Tajikistan
Download Project Document :

Project Name : Partnership for Revitalization of Rural Areas
Project starting date: 20 April 2010
Project ending data: 31 December 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.rs/index.cfm?event=public.ProjectsDetails&revid=58E58422-AAD8-835E-2DF044D0BD011738
Brief description : The purpose of the project is to share the experience of new EU member States with Serbian municipalities regarding preparations for development and implementation of rural development policies. Through a combination of different capacity development methods, the project will help prepare Serbia for implementation of upcoming programmes such as the EU’s  Instrument for Pre-Accession for Rural Development (IPARD). With support from the Government of Romania and the Spanish MDG Achievement Fund, UNDP already supported innovative local and national policies in the field of rural development, including the promotion of Local Action Groups and the EU’s LEADER approach, trainings on financial planning and project development in 5 municipalities in the Autonomous Province of Vojvodina, etc.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 270,000.00
Funding Partners: Gov of Romania- 270 000 USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Agriculture, Trade, Forestry and Water Management
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Alibunar, Serbia
Number of beneficiaries: 7 municipalities and 15 civic associations
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Ms. Jelena Tadzic Email: registry.rs@undp.org Tel: +(381 11) 20 40 400 Fax: +(381 11) 34 44 300
Country: Serbia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.rs/index.cfm?event=public.getFile&fileid=0BABEB38-F030-088C-EF4EBC1440112F28

Project Name : Vlasina Lake Ecotourism Promotion and Environment Protection
Project starting date: August, 2011
Project ending data: August, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.rs/index.cfm?event=public.ProjectsDetails&revid=5906D8BA-A883-AD5B-A2F6ED9E622850FD
Brief description : The project will support the municipality of Surdulica to pursue its strategic vision of ecotourism development through employment generation and preservation of the environmental and cultural heritage in the protected area of the Vlasina Lake. The following outputs will be produced (i) Branding and promotion of the Vlasina Lake as a tourist destination; (ii) Capacity development and awareness raising of local stakeholders on environment protection principles and standards; (iii) Construction of a part of tourist infrastructure at the Vlasina Lake; (iv) Support to the local self-government and the public utility company of Surdulica to protect the environment of the Vlasina Lake.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 231,717.00
Funding Partners: Coca-Cola System and Hellenic Foundation 201 717 USD UNDP-30 000 USD
Implementing partners (both central and local): The Ministry of Environment, Mining and Spatial Planning Regional Development Agency for Pcinja and Jablanica Districts Coca-Cola System and Hellenic Foundation

Number of beneficiaries: Protected area of Vlasina, municipality of Surdulica

Project Name : Improving Service Delivery at the Local Level (Alibunar)
Project starting date: 1-Sep-12
Project ending data: 31-Dec-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.rs/index.cfm?event=public.ProjectsDetails&revid=709E62A5-01CF-4892-EEBF4CEE72EB988A
Brief description : The purpose of the project is to support the municipality of Alibunar to generate employment and improve the environmental protection. The following results will be delivered (i) improved organization of municipal administration, (ii) establishment of the farm land protection service in Alibunar, (iii) improved system for collecting waste in Alibunar, (iv) establishment of shelterbelts in Alibunar and (v)improved offer of tourist attractions in Alibunar

Project Name : Improving Service Delivery at the Local Level (Cajetina)
Project starting date: 1-May-12
Project ending data: 31-Dec-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.rs/index.cfm?event=public.ProjectsDetails&revid=70A72C38-AE07-9BE5-4FA8C887B1C6FAB5
Brief description : The purpose of the project is to support the municipality of Cajetina in improving service delivery at local level , in particular in the area of energy efficiency and sustainable tourism. The project will deliver the following results: (i)capacity building of municipal officials and local agricultural producers, (ii) creating outdoor camp on Zlatibor and (iii) introducing energy efficient systems in municipality of Cajetina
Thematic area : Environment and Energy

Country: Serbia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.ru/download.php?1602
Project Name : Standards and Labels for Promoting Energy Efficiency in Russia
Project starting date: April 2006
Project ending data: 2014
Visit project website: http://label-ee.ru/eng/Pages/default.aspx
Brief description : The project aims to mitigate greenhouse gas emissions in the Russian Federation through the facilitation of wide-scale market transformation towards energy efficient technical building equipment and household appliances. It will be approached through a phased introduction of energy efficiency standards and labeling.This envisaged to be achieved by (1) improving the national legal and regulatory environment and institutional capacities to facilitate the introduction and wide-spread application of a comprehensive energy efficiency standards and labeling programme; (2) developing energy efficiency standards and labels (S&L) schemes and public procurement models;(3) supporting manufacturers and other supply-chain stakeholders and establishing public-private partnerships, voluntary agreements and joint strategies to make energy efficient products more competitive and affordable to the population; and (4) raising awareness of and providing access to information to targeted end users and buyers of equipment, including both household consumers and commercial buyers.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 64,185,000.00

Project Name : Building energy efficiency in the North West of Russia
Project starting date: January 2009
Project ending data: December 2015
Visit project website: http://www.undp-eeb.ru/index.php?lang=en
Brief description : Project objective is to build local capacities for and demonstrate local solutions to improved energy efficiency in construction and maintenance of buildings in the North West of Russia: Pskov, Vologda and Arkhangelsk Oblasts. Project objective will be achieved through the following outcomes designed to address key barriers to building energy efficiency; (i) Capacity building and know-how; (ii) Demonstration of local energy efficient solutions and management models. Main expected result of the Project Preparatory Grant stage is the preparation of a project document for submission of a full-sized project grant request to Global Environment Facility (GEF).
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 33,180,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF- USD 5,840,000 , Co financing- USD 27,000,000 ; Grant: GEF- USD 140,000 , Government of Russia- USD 200,000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Office of Plenipotentiary Representative of the President of the RF in the North-West Federal Okrug, Administrations of Arkhangelsk, Pskov and Vologda regions
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Vologda
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Ms. Nataly Olofinskaya  Head of Unit Email: registry.ru@undp.org Tel: +7 495 787 2100
Country: Russia

Project Name : Strengthening Protected Area System of the Komi Republic to Conserve Virgin Forest Biodiversity in the Pechora River Headwaters Region
Project starting date: January 2006
Project ending data: February 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp-komi.org/en/
Brief description : The project aims to improve the representation of the Scandinavian and Russian taiga and Ural montane forest tundra in the federal, regional and local system of protected areas. The initiative is centered in the Komi Republic (KR) which is a key repository of biodiversity of these ecosystems. KR has established a protected area system (PAS) to safeguard its globally significant biodiversity covering 14.6% of its territory, which is almost double the Russian average. The project will support this restructuring process by seeking to enhance the systemic and institutional capacities so manage the redesigned system and to diversify income streams to ensure the PA System is more financially sustainable. 
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 21,508,500.00
Funding Partners: GEF- USD 4,500,000 , Government of Germany- USD4,428,500 , Co financing- USD 12,580,000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment of the Russian Federation, Government of the Republic of Komi, Pechora-Ilych State Nature Reserve, Yugyd va National Park, local NGOs and community groups, private sector companies in the Republic of Komi
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Syktyvkar
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Ms. Nataly Olofinskaya  Head of Unit Email: registry.ru@undp.org Tel: +7 495 787 2100
Country: Russia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.ru/download.php?1793
Project Name : Strengthening the Marine and Coastal Protected Areas of Russia
Project starting date: February 2009
Project ending data: December 2013
Visit project website: http://mpa-russia.ru/en/
Brief description : The project aims at facilitating expansion of the national system of marine and coastal protected areas (MCPA) and improve its management effectiveness. The expected outcomes from the project are iImproved MCPA system-level capacity enables the expansion of the MCPA system, MCPA management know-how is demonstrated, expanded and reinforced and strengthened MCPA system effectively captures knowledge and enables replication of best practice.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.ru/download.php?1789
Project Name : Mainstreaming biodiversity conservation into Russia’s energy sector policies and operations
Project starting date: March 2011
Project ending data: March 2016
Visit project website: http://www.undp.ru/index.php?iso=RU&lid=1&cmd=programs&id=205
Brief description : The objective of the project is to mainstream biodiversity conservation priorities into Russian energy sector development policies and into the operations of energy production sectors through pilot activities in 8 demonstration areas of the country.  The expected exponential growth of Russia’s energy sector means a potential further rise in threats to biodiversity. Whether and to what extent these threats materialize depends on if the baseline course of action is corrected to address biodiversity risks.  The desired long-term solution is for Russia to adapt its legislation and policies to include legal requirements for energy sector actors to take into consideration biodiversity conservation, and to develop and test technologies to implement these requirements in each industry. By doing so, Russia will be able to both minimize the adverse impact of energy sector development on biodiversity, and motivate positive actions to conserve biodiversity. 
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 39,503,636.00
Funding Partners: GEF- USD 7,200,000 ; Grant: GEF- USD 173,636 , Government of Russia- USD 180,000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Energy, Ministry of Economic Development, Ministry of Regional Development, Regional Administrations of the pilot regions, energy companies, Russian Association of Indigenous Peoples of the North (RAIPON), environmental NGOs
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Volgograd region
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Ms. Nataly Olofinskaya  Head of Unit Email: registry.ru@undp.org Tel: +7 495 787 2100
Country: Russia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.ru/download.php?1778
Project Name : Integrated Natural Resource Management in the Baikal Basin Transboundary Ecosystem (Russia, Mongolia)
Project starting date: March 2011
Project ending data: December 2014
Visit project website: http://baikal.iwlearn.org/ ; www.everydropmatters.ru
Brief description : The project aims to catalyze the development and implementation of a Strategic Action Programme (SAP) for the transboundary management and conservation of the Baikal Basin’s aquatic ecosystems, building upon a solid baseline of bilateral cooperation between Russia and Mongolia. The project will support efforts from both national and local governments and civil society to mainstream biodiversity conservation measures into mining and tourism sector policies and practices and watershed management planning, leading to improved management of biodiversity and aquatic ecosystems across 11,047,790 hectares. The project’s objective is to spearhead integrated natural resource management of Baikal Lake Basin and Hövsgöl Lake ensuring ecosystem resilience, reduced water quality threats in the context of sustainable economic development.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 53,306,169.00
Funding Partners: GEF- USD 3,898,000 ; Grant: USD 120,000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment of Russia, Ministry of Nature and Environment of Mongolia, UNESCO, Russian Academy of Science, Federal and Regional authorities in charge of Lake Baikal issues, research institutions and universities
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Ulan Ude

Contact person : Ms. Nataly Olofinskaya  Head of Unit Email: registry.ru@undp.org Tel: +7 495 787 2100
Country: Russia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.ru/download.php?1922
Project Name : Reducing GHG emissions from road transport in Russia's medium-sized cities, Russian Urban Sustainable Transport (RUST)
Project starting date: October 2012
Project ending data: September 2017
Visit project website: http://www.undp.ru/index.php?iso=RU&lid=1&cmd=programs&id=216
Brief description : Project objective is to reduce GHG emissions from the road transport sector by piloting low carbon modes of transport systems in medium-sized Russian cities. Pilot cities are Kazan and Kaliningrad. The pilots will inform federal and local level policies towards the development of sustainable transport in Russia, and provide examples to other secondary cities of Russia to replicate. The main outcomes of the project will be the pilot projects in the two demonstration cities, supportive federal policies and legislative framework for sustainable transport in the Russian Federation and successful information dissemination and replication of the pilot activities.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 163,536,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF- USD 5,400,000 , Ministry of Transport- USD 8,600,000 , Ministry of Transport and Road Construction of the Republic of Tatarstan- USD 113,000,000 , Administation of K.- USD 34,656,000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Transport, Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, Ministry of Transport and Road Construction of the Republic of Tatarstan, Administration of Kaliningrad, Ministry of Interior
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kazan

Country: Russia
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.ru/download.php?1779
Project Name : Greening 2014 Sochi Olympics: A Strategy and Action Plan for the Greening Legacy
Project starting date: 2011
Project ending data: 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.ru/index.php?iso=RU&lid=1&cmd=programs&id=206
Brief description : The project aims at addressing climate change mitigation through greening a large international event in Russia – the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympic games. The project's objective is to produce a Greening Strategy and Action Plan for the 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi. The project will develop greening recommendations and action plans in six specific sectors. By introducing an early Climate Change planning the project will help setting up a "carbon neutral" event and unleash the potential for greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions reduction during the preparation to and conduction of the Sochi Olympic games. In doing so the MSP project will produce an integrated programmatic approach (a set of project proposals) for the Greening of Sochi Olympics. The expected results are 'Green building standards', 'Energy efficiency and power planning', 'Renewable energy technologies', 'Low carbon transport', 'Carbon offsests', 'Public awareness and advocacy strategy'.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 14,542,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF- USD 900,000 , UK Government- USD 65,000 ; Grant: USD 125,000 (of which GEF- USD 55,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment of Russia , Sochi-2014 Organizing Committee, State Corporation "Olympstroy", Sochi City Administration, Krasnodar Kray Administration, Olympic Investors
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Sochi

Country: Russia

Project Name : Capacity Development Programme (CDP)
Project starting date: 2010
Project ending data: 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/dg/projects/CDP/index.html
Brief description : The main purpose of the overall Capacity Development Programme activities is to provide support to efforts of Government in strengthening the institutional and administrative capacities of Montenegro for European Integration. CDP has been supporting a series of institutional and functional horizontal and vertical reviews, re-structuring and reorganization in different ministries. The third phase is focused on further support to the European Integration process, supporting the development and implementation of the new Strategy on Public Administration Reform for 2010-2015 and capacity development of relevant Government structures for EU integration.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance

Total budget (USD): 2,300,000.00

Project Name : Rule of Law and Human Rights Programme
Project starting date: 2010
Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/dg/projects/Rule%20of%20Law%20and%20Human%20Rights%20Programme/index.html
Brief description : The UNDP Montenegro is involved in the judicial reform area since 2004. The Rule of Law and Human Rights Programme has been providing policy and technical support to the Ministry of Justice in drafting the most important documents in this field, such as the Strategy and Action Plan for the implementation of the reform of Judiciary (2007-2012), Criminal Procedure Code and changes and amendments to the Criminal Code. Ongoing efforts are focused on responding to major priorities: independence of judiciary, efficiency of justice, access to justice, corruption and integrity and organized crime and include: adoption of the Law on Legal Aid that will for the first time establish a Legal Aid system in Montenegro and enabling its efficient implementation, strengthening the capacities of the national Center for Mediation, promotion of mediation and alternative sanctions, strengthening the capacities of judiciary to fight corruption and organized crime through the continuous education as well as a series of tailored trainings for judges and prosecutors, in cooperation with the national Judicial Training Center.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 846,000.00
Funding Partners: Government of Netherlands ($215,827), Government of Norway ($ 545,000), Government of United Kingdom ($95,000)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Justice, Judicial Training Centre
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Justice, Judicial Training Centre
Contact person : Ms. Sanja Bojanic, Democratic Governance Team Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/dg/projects/Montenegro%20Demilitarization/prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Montenegro Demilitarization (MONDEM)
Project starting date: April 2007
Project ending data: December 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/dg/projects/Montenegro%20Demilitarization/index.html
Brief description : The project was established as a result of a request from the Government of Montenegro to UNDP for an independent assessment of the demilitarisation and safe storage of conventional ammunition in Montenegro. The Ministry of Defence of Montenegrohttp has indicated that demilitarisation and safe storage of conventional ammunition is a priority during the defence reform process. The programme has four components: disposal of hazardous rocket propellant, stockpile management and security, demilitarization, and destruction of heavy weapons.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 5,100,000.00
Funding Partners: Government of the Netherlands USD 1,816,200 / Government of Montenegro USD 1,000,000 / Government of the United Kingdom USD 504,000 / Government of Sweden through BCPR USD 344,000/Government of Denmark USD 150,000/OSCE Participating States USD 838,618/EC through SEESAC regional programme USD 260,000.
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Defense of Montenegro and OSCE
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Defense of Montenegro and OSCE
Contact person : Ms. Sanja Bojanic, Democratic Governance Team Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/dg/projects/Local%20Governance%20Capacity%20Development%20in%20Montenegro/LG%20Capacity%20Development/ProDoc.pdf
Project Name : Local Governance Programme
Project starting date: January 2010
Project ending data: April 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/dg/projects/Local%20Governance%20Capacity%20Development%20in%20Montenegro/index.html
Brief description : The projcet is aimed at responding to currently identified three major challenges. Firstly, in relation to the lack of capacities for service provision at the local level the UNDP is supporting the Ministry of the Interior and municipalities through the Union of Municipalities of Montenegro in strengthening the inter-municipal cooperation as well as strengthening local public finances through better budgeting and support to improving allocation process of the equalization funds. Secondly, directly with municipalities the UNDP works on empowering of Municipal Assembly members and Secretary Generals by building administrative capacities to become more efficient and responsive to the local citizens needs and requests, as well as to exercise better their legislative power and their role of supervising the executive branch. Thirdly, the UNDP will contribute to understanding and addressing the human resource challenge at the local level by conducting a functional analysis for Montenegrin municipalities in close partnership with the European Union Delegation under the IPA 2010.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,460,000.00
Funding Partners: Czech Trust Fund ($68,275) UNDP Montenegro ($238,027) Government of Netherlands ($1.019,161) Government of Montenegro ($137,362)
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Interior, Union of Municipalities, Municipalities in Montenegro, UNDP BRC, UNDP FYR Macedonia
Number of project staff : 4
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Interior, Union of Municipalities, Municipalities in Montenegro, UNDP BRC, UNDP FYR Macedonia
Contact person : Ms. Sanja Bojanic, Democratic Governance Team Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/dg/projects/Anti-corruption%20Programme/Anti-Corruption%20capacity%20building%20of%20DACI/prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Anti-corruption Programme
Project starting date: September 2010
Project ending data: September 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/dg/projects/Anti-corruption%20Programme/index.html
Brief description : This project facilitated the completion of two assessments of the integrity and capacity of the judiciary system and the local-self governance. Currently, two more researches focusing on the integrity of the health sector and the state administration are ongoing, supported by a subsequent two-year project which aimed to provide support in the implementation of the National Action Plan to combat corruption and organized crime. Future efforts will be directed towards securing adequate follow up to the two ongoing researches in terms of resource mobilization and relevant policy and institutional changes.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance

Total budget (USD): 417,817.00
Funding Partners: Norway: USD 377 817 TRAC: USD 40 000

Project Name : Non-communicable diseases prevention: Enhancing service provision to adults with intellectual disabilities residing at ‘Komanski Most‘ in health, social and other related sectors” 
Project starting date: January 2011
Project ending data: Dec-12
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Non-communicable%20diseases%20prevention/index.html
Brief description : The project aims to improve service provision and deliver new services to vulnerable groups (VGs) and namely to the Komanski Most Institute’s beneficiaries and to the residents currently living in Konik, the largest suburb of Podgorica, in a comprehensive, sustained, and sustainable manner, bringing both the institution and Konik suburb to a higher level of organisational development. The main actions would be (i) institutional, structural and organisational transformation of the Institute “Komanski Most” into a Centre of Support to Adults in order to enhance service provision and, at the same time, deliver new services.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 77,713.00
Funding Partners: MDTF: USD 66,713 TRAC: USD 5,000
