Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Durable%20solutions%20for%20refugees/prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Durable solutions for refugees, displaced and domicile Roma in Montenegro – Konik Study – (Enhancing Service Provision to Vulnerable Population in Health, Social Sector and other related sectors)”
Project starting date: January 2011
Project ending data: Jun-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Durable%20solutions%20for%20refugees/index.html
Brief description : This project will aim to provide support for refugees, displaced and domicile Roma in Montenegro, through conducting a research study on durable solutions for Konik residents, in the areas that represent the key challenges for this suburb, which are poverty, unemployment, security, infrastructure, public services, respect for basic and human rights. The impact of this study will be seen through the enhanced dialogue among interested parties in identifying and implementing both the specific durable solutions for individuals within population groups living in the Konik area, and the mechanisms to attain the identified durable solutions for each population group, as well as in supporting the development of the entire Konik area. In the phase two of the project direct support to the beneficiaries in obtaining their personal documents and in resolving their status related issues in Montenegro, will be provided.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 209,000.00
Funding Partners: MDTF
Implementing partners (both central and local): Government of Montenegro, Ministry of Labor and Social Welfare, NGO Legal Center
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries: 2500
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Displaced popuilation, Roma , refugees
Contact person : Contact person: Mr. Miodrag Dragišić, SI Cluster Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Gender%20Programme/prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Gender Programme IPA 2010
Project starting date: March 2011
Project ending data: March 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Gender%20Programme/index.html
Brief description : The project aims at supporting achievement of sustainable and efficient system for the protection of victims of domestic violence and sustainable measures to combat violence in family. Focus is to ensure that the new Law on Protection of Victims of Violence is fairly interpreted and implemented in daily practice, ensuring that victims do experience system-wide support. Creation of a sustainable coordination and monitoring multidisciplinary mechanism at the national and local level will be priority. Second component focuses on enhancing gender sensitivity in political parties and administrative authorities. Party and electoral system reform have proved as an effective entry points for increasing women’s political activism. Key words: gender, empowerment of women, legislation, women’s entrepreneurship.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 1,127,536.00
Funding Partners: EU – 700,000 Euro or $1,014,492 UNDP TRAC resources – 78,000 Euro or $113,043
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry for Human and Minority Rights
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries: n/a
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Office of Gender Equality, Women political leaders. Women entrepreneurs, Victims of domestic violence

Project starting date: July 2010
Project ending data: Dec-12
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Good%20Health%20System%20Governance%20for%20Montenegro/index.html
Brief description : This project will support further reform process of the Health sector reform in Montenegro, and its aim is to enhance the provision of quality secondary and tertiary level health services by raising the capacity of the health professionals and reducing health inequalities by promoting good governance for increased transparency and accountability of the sector.

Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/National%20Human%20Development%20Report%20-%20NHDR/ProDoc.pdf
Project Name : NATIONAL HUMAN DEVELOPMENT REPORT (NHDR): ‘People are the real wealth of the country’ How rich is Montenegro?
Project starting date: January 2009
Project ending data: Feb-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/National%20Human%20Development%20Report%20-%20NHDR/index.html
Brief description : NHDR will consider the status of human capital in Montenegro (who are we?), the trends in its formation/depletion since the beginning of transition, the institutional mechanisms involved, and it will make recommendations on improving the efficiency of human capital formation and utilization. The analysis and the recommendations will be constructed against the background of the vision of Montenegro in 15-20 years from now and will try to address two questions: 1. Who are we? and 2. Where are we going?. The NHDR is, for its broader outreach, presented though a TV serial (28 one hour programmes) “I have an attitude (Ja imam stav)” in cooperation with Atlas TV.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 315,070.29
Funding Partners: The Kingdom of Norway NOK 1,026,200-181,205.29 USD; UNDP $133,865
Implementing partners (both central and local):
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries: n/a
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Governamnt of Montenegro, Citizens of Montenegro , Civil society

Project Name : Scale up response to HIV/AIDS among most-at-risk populations in Montenegro
Project starting date: 1 July 2010
Project ending data: 30-Jun-15
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Scale%20up%20response%20to%20%20HIV-AIDS%20among%20most-at-risk%20groups%20in%20MNE.doc/index.html
Brief description : The project objective is to prevent HIV transmission among most-at-risk populations: to improve the quality of care and support to PLHIV, to create a supportive environment for HIV prevention and care, to strengthen the HIV surveillance system among most-at-risk populations, and to increase the capacity and coordination of a focused response to HIV among most-at-risk populations.

Project Name : Establishing and pursuing a high quality of tuberculosis control programme in Montenegro
Project starting date: 1 July 2010
Project ending data: 30 June 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Tuberculosis%20control%20programme%20in%20Montenegro/index.html
Brief description : The overall goal of the project is establishing and pursuing a high quality and effective TB control programme, which will result in significant reduction of morbidity, mortality and transmission of the TB infection. This effort will result in an improved base of knowledge for professionals involved in the battle against TB, be they doctors, nurses, lab technicians, social workers or policy decision makers. In terms of detection, strengthening the National Reference Laboratory is one of the main objectives. Community Advocacy and Mobilization - will increase public awareness of TB. It will help those afflicted with the disease by reducing discrimination against them. This will also make it more likely that citizens will submit to screenings and treatments more willingly.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 1,644,274.82
Funding Partners: GFATM
Implementing partners (both central and local): Special Hospital for Lung Diseases “Dr. Jovan Bulajić”,  Brezovik bb, Nikšić, Project Manager: Ms. Olivera Bojović, MD NGO CAZAS, Crnogorskih serdara bb, Podgorica, Project Manager: Ms Amela Kovačević
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries: approximately 500 (TB patients and their families, health proffessionals)
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person :
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Social%20welfare%20and%20child%20care%20system%20reform%20-%20Enhancing%20social%20inclusion/prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Social welfare and child care system reform - Enhancing social inclusion
Project starting date: January 2011
Project ending data: July 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Social%20welfare%20and%20child%20care%20system%20reform%20-%20Enhancing%20social%20inclusion/index.html
Brief description : The project aims at building and strengthening the institutional mechanisms and capacities that will enable development of community-based social services. The services will be responsive to the needs of the vulnerable groups and will contribute to their social inclusion and quality of life. UNDP CO Montenegro, together with Ministry of Labour and Social Welfare (MLSW), Ministry of Education (MoE ) and UNICEF developed a joint project: “Enhancing Social Inclusion” composed of 3 components funded by European Commission through IPA. UNDP implements component No. 2 worth 1.3mil Euro dealing with Social welfare reform. The project commences in January 2011 and it lasts 30 months. 
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 1,551,876.00
Funding Partners: EU (IPA funds)  – 1,180,400.00 Eur UNDP TRAC resources - 118,040.00 Eur Total Project budget: 1,298,440.00 Eur
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Labour and Social Welfare, Local authorities,UNICEF, Red Cross
Number of project staff : 4
Name of the location (region/district, village): Niksic, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries: 1452
Name of beneficiaries or organization : 9 municipalities, 5 Social Welfare Centers, 5 Employment Bureaues, 25 NGOs, excluded individuals and families living in 9 municiplities in Montenegro
Contact person : Ms. Aleksandra Kiković E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Social%20welfare%20and%20child%20care%20system%20reform%20-%20Enhancing%20social%20inclusion/prodoc.pdf
Project Name : Social welfare and child care system reform - Enhancing social inclusion
Project starting date: January 2011
Project ending data: July 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/si/projects/Social%20welfare%20and%20child%20care%20system%20reform%20-%20Enhancing%20social%20inclusion/index.html

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/GEF%20Enabling%20Activities%20for%20the%20Preparation%20of%20Montenegro%E2%80%99s%20Second%20National%20Communication%20(SNC)%20to%20the%20UN%20Framework%20Convention%20on%20Climate%20Change%20(UNFCCC)/ProDoc.pdf
Project Name : GEF Enabling Activities for the Preparation of Montenegro’s Second National Communication (SNC) to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)
Project starting date: 1 March, 2011
Project ending data: 1 March, 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/GEF%20Enabling%20Activities%20for%20the%20Preparation%20of%20Montenegro%E2%80%99s%20Second%20National%20Communication%20(SNC)%20to%20the%20UN%20Framework%20Convention%20on%20Climate%20Change%20(UNFCCC)/index.html
Brief description : This project aims to enable Montenegro to prepare, produce and disseminate its Second National Communication (SNC) to the Conference of the Parties (CoP) of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) according to Decision 17/CP8 and other guidance provided. The SNC will update and strengthen information provided regarding national circumstances, greenhouse gas inventories, climate change mitigation, vulnerability to climate change and steps taken to adapt to climate change, and information on public awareness, education, training, systematic research and observation, and technology transfer. The project will also increase the capacity to produce subsequent NCs that meet CoP guidelines and inform policies in Montenegro.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 500,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF - 500,000 UNDP - 30,000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism of Montenegro
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism of Montenegro
Contact person : Ms. Milica Begović-Radojević, PhD, EE Cluster Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/Small%20Hydropower%20Development%20in%20Montenegro/ProDoc.pdf
Project Name : Power Sector Policy Reform to Promote Small Hydropower Development in Montenegro
Project starting date: Mar-08
Project ending data: Jun-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/Small%20Hydropower%20Development%20in%20Montenegro/index.html
Brief description : The project will support the government in realizing its goal of 15 to 20 MW of new small generating capacity by the close of the project, instead of 2015 as declared by their strategy. Furthermore this project will support the government in securing that additional capacity in a more cost effective and economically responsible manner, and therefore in a more politically sustainable manner. The project will do this by supporting the Government of Montenegro (GoM) in: streamlining and simplifying the application procedures for small renewable independent power producers; - collecting basic data to make investment decisions; - by setting attractive but competitive business terms and conditions for investors; - and helping the new Energy Efficiency (EE) and Renewable Energy Unit role out a streamlined and transparent tendering process.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 1,018,400.00
Funding Partners: GEF- 978 393  UNDP-40 000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Economy Energy Regulatory Agency Hydrometeorological Institute Business community Local governments
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Economy Energy Regulatory Agency Hydrometeorological Institute Business community Local governments
Contact person : Ms. Milica Begović-Radojević, PhD, EE Cluster Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/Sustainability%20of%20the%20Protected%20Area%20System%20of%20Montenegro/Project%20Document.pdf
Project Name : Strengthening the sustainability of the protected area system of Montenegro
Project starting date: October 2009
Project ending data: Dec-13
Visit project website: http://undp.akvoapp.org/en/project/648/
Brief description : The project has the objective of ‘developing the capacity in protected area institutions to design, plan and manage a more representative system of protected areas’. The project has two components – along with their associated outcomes, outputs and activities - which will contribute towards achieving the project objective. The project will focus activities at two levels of intervention: (i) the national level, through working with public institutions and agencies in order to develop the capacity to consolidate, expand and effectively manage the PAS; and (ii) the local level, through working directly with the key stakeholder groups and local communities in order to establish the first  Regional Park in Montenegro in the Komovi region, and to assess the feasibility of establishing a Marine Protected Area in the region of the Platamuni cliffs along the Adriatic coast.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 990,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF- 950 000  UNDP-40 000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism; Ministry of Agriculture and rural development; PE National Parks; Municipalities of: Podgorica, Kolasin, Andrijevica, Pluzine, Kotor, Tivat.
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Podgorica, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries: 50,000
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism; Ministry of Agriculture and rural development; PE National Parks; Municipalities of: Podgorica, Kolasin, Andrijevica, Pluzine, Kotor, Tivat.
Contact person : Ms. Milica Begović-Radojević, PhD, EE Cluster Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/Sustainability%20of%20the%20Protected%20Area%20System%20of%20Montenegro/Project%20Document.pdf

Project Name : Strengthening the sustainability of the protected area system of Montenegro
Project starting date: October 2009
Project ending data: Dec-13
Visit project website: http://undp.akvoapp.org/en/project/648/
Brief description : The project has the objective of ‘developing the capacity in protected area institutions to design, plan and manage a more representative system of protected areas’. The project has two components – along with their associated outcomes, outputs and activities - which will contribute towards achieving the project objective. The project will focus activities at two levels of intervention: (i) the national level, through working with public institutions and agencies in order to develop the capacity to consolidate, expand and effectively manage the PAS; and (ii) the local level, through working directly with the key stakeholder groups and local communities in order to establish the first  Regional Park in Montenegro in the Komovi region, and to assess the feasibility of establishing a Marine Protected Area in the region of the Platamuni cliffs along the Adriatic coast.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 990,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF- 950 000  UNDP-40 000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism; Ministry of Agriculture and rural development; PE National Parks; Municipalities of: Podgorica, Kolasin, Andrijevica, Pluzine, Kotor, Tivat.
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Kotor, Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries: 50,000
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism; Ministry of Agriculture and rural development; PE National Parks; Municipalities of: Podgorica, Kolasin, Andrijevica, Pluzine, Kotor, Tivat.
Contact person : Ms. Milica Begović-Radojević, PhD, EE Cluster Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro

Project Name : Strengthening the sustainability of the protected area system of Montenegro
Project starting date: October 2009
Project ending data: Dec-13
Visit project website: http://undp.akvoapp.org/en/project/648/
Brief description : The project has the objective of ‘developing the capacity in protected area institutions to design, plan and manage a more representative system of protected areas’. The project has two components – along with their associated outcomes, outputs and activities - which will contribute towards achieving the project objective. The project will focus activities at two levels of intervention: (i) the national level, through working with public institutions and agencies in order to develop the capacity to consolidate, expand and effectively manage the PAS; and (ii) the local level, through working directly with the key stakeholder groups and local communities in order to establish the first  Regional Park in Montenegro in the Komovi region, and to assess the feasibility of establishing a Marine Protected Area in the region of the Platamuni cliffs along the Adriatic coast.

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/Catalyzing%20financial%20sustainability%20of%20the%20protected%20areas%20system%20in%20Montenegro%20(PAF)/ProDoc.pdf
Project Name : Catalyzing financial sustainability of the protected areas system in Montenegro (PAF)
Project starting date: Mar-10
Project ending data: Dec-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/Catalyzing%20financial%20sustainability%20of%20the%20protected%20areas%20system%20in%20Montenegro%20(PAF)/index.html
Brief description : The project will improve the financial sustainability of PA system in MNE through enabling legal and policy environment for improvement financial sustainability, securing revenue streams for PA, and development of institutional and individual capacities of PA institutions to raise PA management cost-effectiveness. Results include: a) piloting payment for ecosystem services (PES) scheme in Durmitor, nature-based tourism concession process in Komovi Regional Park, and innovative revenue generation for PA (rafting, canoeing, kayaking, biking, rock climbing, caving,etc); b) development of a national 5-yaer PA funding plan; c) developing institution capacity to raise management cost-effectiveness and improving legal/policy environment for PA financial sustainability.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 990,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF- 950 000  UNDP-40 000

Project Name : Capacity Building for Integration of Global Environment Commitments in Investment/Development Decision
Project starting date: May 2011
Project ending data: May 2014
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/GEF/GEF%20Capacity%20Building%20for%20Integration/index.html
Brief description : The project objective is to analyze, identify, and pilot advanced tools and practices for environmental information management and compliance monitoring of the national implementation of the Rio Conventions. Specifically, the project would develop national capacities collect and analyze data and information against the metrics of global environmental indicators, and integrate these within national sustainable development and environmental decision-making processes. The expected outcome of this project is that a systematic and sustainable approach to assessing global environmental achievements through the implementation of national policies, programmes and plans has been initiated.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy

Total budget (USD): 527,700.00
Funding Partners: GEF -502 700 UNDP-25 000

Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/Beautiful%20Cetinje/ProDoc%20Beautiful%20Cetinje.pdf
Project Name : “Beautiful Cetinje” project
Project starting date: July 2011
Project ending data: December 2013
Visit project website: http://undp.akvoapp.org/en/project/498/
Brief description : Beautiful Cetinje projects seeks to economically revitalize the city through a variety of measures aimed at support to small business and renovation and adaptation of buildings and public spaces that are part of historical and cultural heritage in order to preserve them, but also to improve them by implementing energy–efficiency measures and sustainable design ideas thus making buildings and public spaces more environmentally friendly. Additionally, this project will create opportunity for providing vocational trainings in specific construction skills to significant number of unemployed people in Cetinje, which will then have the opportunity to apply for new temporary or permanent jobs which will be subsequently hired by firms contracted by the project to refurbish and further maintain chosen buildings and public spaces.

Brief description : This project will aim at development of nature based tourism in Montenegro, with special focus on hiking and biking, and tourism safety through adoption of legislation framework and capacity building activities, as well as development of cross border nature-based tourism offer.

Project ending data: Dec-13

Brief description : The project goals is integrating sustainable development principles into processes of spatial planning and legalization of informal settlements and improving enforcement of the legislation on Planning and Construction, thereby establishing a clear link between economic growth, poverty reduction and environmental sustainability.

Project Name : Strategy for Sustainable Economic Growth in Montenegro through Introduction of Clusters by the end of 2016
Project starting date: Sep-10
Project ending data: Dec-12
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/ee/projects/Strategy%20for%20Sustainable%20Economic%20Growth/index.html
Brief description : The purpose of the project is to strengthen the competitiveness and market access of selected clusters and networks in Montenegro, with a special emphasis on the more impoverished Northern region. In this context it will foster a more equitable integration of small and medium scale businesses in that region into domestic and international value/supply chains of through enhanced dynamism, collective efficiency, productivity and viable business partnerships with private sector investors. It will also strengthen the relevant business support institutions and government bodies to provide required services and assistance schemes to these clusters, thus building local and national capabilities by training and coaching.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy

Project Name : Coastal Area Management Programme
Project starting date: Nov-11
Project ending data: Dec-13
Visit project website: https://finance.partneragencies.org/psp/UNDPP1FS_1/EMPLOYEE/ERP/c/ESTABLISH_AWARDS.PROJECT_GENERAL.GBL
Brief description : The main goals of the CAMP Project for Montenegro are: a) to create necessary mechanisms that can help achieve sustainable development of the coastal area; b) to support implementation of national policies and ICZM Protocol; c) to promote integrated and participatory planning and management in the coastal area; d) to build national and local capacities for ICZM and raise awareness of the importance of the coastal area, complexity and fragility of its ecosystems and of the need for integrated approaches in managing them; and e) to facilitate the transfer of knowledge on ICZM tools and approaches.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 194,610.00
Funding Partners: Government of Montenegro 194,610
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism of Montenegro

Name of the location (region/district, village): Coastal area of Montenegro (Municipalities – Herceg Novi, Kotor, Tivat, Budva, Bar and Ulcinj
Number of beneficiaries: 3 state institutions 6 Municipalities NGOs

Download Project Document :
Project Name : National Biodiversity Planning to Support the implementation of the CBD 2011-2020 Strategic Plan in Montenegro
Project starting date: Apr-12
Project ending data: Dec-14
Visit project website: https://finance.partneragencies.org/psp/UNDPP1FS_1/EMPLOYEE/ERP/c/ESTABLISH_AWARDS.PROJECT_GENERAL.GBL
Brief description : The project addresses the country’s need to continue to fulfill its obligations under the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD). It is a significant contribution to Montenegro’s efforts towards implementing the CBD Strategic Plan 2011-2020 at the national level. The project builds on the current status and achievements of Montenegro with respect to biodiversity planning and reporting. It aims to integrate Montenegro’s obligations under the CBD into its national development and sectoral planning frameworks through a renewed and participative ‘biodiversity planning’ and strategizing process. This process is expected to produce measurable targets for biodiversity conservation and sustainable use.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 215,000.00
Funding Partners: GEF - 210,000 UNDP - 5,000
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Sustainable Development and Tourism of Montenegro
Number of project staff : 2
Name of the location (region/district, village): Montenegro
Number of beneficiaries: 3 state institutions 3 Municipalities 3 NGOs
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; Environmental Protection Agency; Public Enterprise of National Parks MNE; Municipalities Podgorica, Andrijevica and Kolasin NGOs: Green Home, Natura and Center for protection and research of birds of Montenegro
Contact person : Ms. Milica Begović-Radojević, PhD, EE Cluster Leader E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/rep/projects/esi/Project%20Document.pdf
Project Name : Environment and Security Initiative – Transforming Risks into Cooperation in South Eastern Europe
Project starting date: 1-Jul-10
Project ending data: Jul-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/rep/projects/esi/index.html
Brief description : Main goal of this project is to contribute to the reduction of environment and security risks, and to the increased cooperation around environment and security issues in the region of South Eastern Europe (SEE). The Environment and Security Initiative (ENVSEC) supports the ‘Security’ and ‘Energy & Environment’ themes of the framework programme in the Western Balkans through identification, prevention and reduction of environmental conflicts and tensions over shared natural resources and ecosystems, sources of pollution and waste among and within the countries in the Western Balkans and their neighbors. The UNDP program of works and activities in support of this involves the physical cleanup of sites within the Western Balkans, identification of institutional needs and monitoring of these sites in accordance with best practices in combination with capacity building activities and public awareness raising conducted by other EnvSec partners.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 781,572.00
Funding Partners: The Government of Finland $ 781,572
Implementing partners (both central and local): Municipality of Mojkovac, Montenegro; Ministry of Environment, Albania
Number of project staff : 3
Name of the location (region/district, village): Northern part of Montenegro, Mojkovac, Zuta Prla mine; Northern Mirdita District, Lezha Region, Albania Rreps Settlement
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Municipality of Mojkovac, Montenegro; Lezha Region, Albania
Contact person : Regional Programme Manager Ms. Snežana Dragojević E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.org.me/rep/projects/esi/Project%20Document.pdf
Project Name : Environment and Security Initiative – Transforming Risks into Cooperation in South Eastern Europe
Project starting date: 1-Jul-10
Project ending data: Jul-13
Visit project website: http://www.undp.org.me/rep/projects/esi/index.html
Brief description : Main goal of this project is to contribute to the reduction of environment and security risks, and to the increased cooperation around environment and security issues in the region of South Eastern Europe (SEE). The Environment and Security Initiative (ENVSEC) supports the ‘Security’ and ‘Energy & Environment’ themes of the framework programme in the Western Balkans through identification, prevention and reduction of environmental conflicts and tensions over shared natural resources and ecosystems, sources of pollution and waste among and within the countries in the Western Balkans and their neighbors. The UNDP program of works and activities in support of this involves the physical cleanup of sites within the Western Balkans, identification of institutional needs and monitoring of these sites in accordance with best practices in combination with capacity building activities and public awareness raising conducted by other EnvSec partners.
Thematic area : Environment and Energy
Icon name: small_green
Total budget (USD): 781,572.00
Funding Partners: The Government of Finland $ 781,572
Implementing partners (both central and local): Municipality of Mojkovac, Montenegro; Ministry of Environment, Albania
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Northern part of Montenegro, Mojkovac, Zuta Prla mine; Northern Mirdita District, Lezha Region, Albania Rreps Settlement
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Municipality of Mojkovac, Montenegro; Lezha Region, Albania
Contact person : Regional Programme Manager Ms. Snežana Dragojević E-mail: registry.me@undp.org Tel: +382 20 22 55 33 Fax: +382 20 22 55 51
Country: Montenegro
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.md/projects/prodoc/NHDR_prodoc_2005%2010%2002.pdf
Project Name : Formulation of National Human Development Reports
Project starting date: January, 2005
Project ending data: December, 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.md/projects/NHDR.shtml
Brief description : The project aims at supporting the development of National Human Development Reports (NHDRs) and other relevant policy analysis/research works.  The project serves as a vehicle through which the Government of Moldova and UNDP identify, study and prioritize Moldova’s socio-economic and human development needs. Moreover, it contributes to better defining the target areas for development policies and improving communication of the country’s developmental needs to the donor community, civil society and the media. Key words: Poverty reduction, HDR, HDI, capacity development, research.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 496,584.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Labour, Social Protection and Family, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Economy, State Chancellery, academia, civil society, private sector.
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Chisinau
Number of beneficiaries: N/A
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Labour, Social Protection and Family, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Economy, State Chancellery, academia, civil society, private sector.
Contact person : Alexandru Oprunenco, Policy Specialist/Programme Manager Email: registry.md@undp.org www.undp.md Tel: + (373 22) 269 202 Fax: +(373 22) 22 00 41
Country: Moldova
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.md/projects/prodoc/ProDoc_Innovation%20Fund%20Project%202012.pdf
Project Name : Fostering transition towards inclusive and sustainable development of Moldova (Innovation Fund)
Project starting date: February ,2012
Project ending data: December ,2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.md/projects/IF.shtml
Brief description : The project supports the Government in designing policies aimed at bolstering innovative approaches towards country's development by facilitating transfer and adoption of the best practices and models to Moldova. The main objectives are (i) tap into knowledge and experience available in the region and beyond in designing/guiding/implementing policies aimed at spurring innovation for sustainable development, including at the SME level and (ii) facilitate and support the organization of short-term study visits to foster experience exchange and establish mechanisms for transfer and adoption of best practices in Moldova. Key words: Poverty reduction, capacity building, chieving sustainable and inclusive development.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 80,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Economy, Institute of Economy, Finance and Statistics, State Chancellery, civil society, private sector.
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Chisinau
Number of beneficiaries: N/A

Country: Moldova
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.md/projects/prodoc/CONCEPT%20NOTE%20AfT.pdf
Project Name : Improving Trade and Productive Capacities of Moldovan Fresh Fruit Producers
Project starting date: July ,2011
Project ending data: December,2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.md/projects/AfT.shtml
Brief description : Part of regional initiative Aid for Trade covering Central Asia, South Caucasus and Western CIS, the project supports inclusive economic growth through the promotion of trade and the enhancement of countries’ competitiveness on international markets. In Moldova the project will help agricultural producers and exporters to improve their international competitiveness and market access externally, both in the CIS and in the EU markets. Particular attention will be paid to strengthening capacities of existing associations of fresh fruit producers as well as members and non-members of the associations. Key words: Poverty reduction, trade, capacity building, business, market, gender.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 589,316.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Moldova, Moldovan Investment and Export Promotion Organization (MIEPO); Associations of Fresh Fruits Producers/ Growers /Exporters; Non associated producers/ growers/ exporters of fresh fruits in Moldova, etc
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Chisinau
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Alexandru Oprunenco, Policy Specialist/Programme Manager Email: registry.md@undp.org www.undp.md Tel: + (373 22) 269 202 Fax: +(373 22) 22 00 41
Country: Moldova
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.md/projects/prodoc/2010/JP_Statistics_ProDoc_11_EN-2.pdf
Project Name : Strengthening the National Statistical System
Project starting date: August,2007
Project ending data: June, 2013
Visit project website: http://www.undp.md/projects/Statistics.shtml
Brief description : The project is aimed at strengthening the national statistical system to improve the collection, dissemination and utilization of statistical information, with particular focus on national needs and overall conformity of official statistics with international standards. Project includes three components dealing with data production, data dissemination and data use. Improve the capacity of the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) and other line ministries involved in production of information through administrative reporting systems, surveys and censuses to produce data in a timely manner, disaggregated by sex, age and geographical territory; Improve the availability of data through improvement of data dissemination systems, practices and tools; Improve the use of available data for participatory policy-making through enhancing statistical users’ literacy by increasing the capacity in government, CSOs and other stakeholders as well as stimulating data use for both in-government and outsourced policy analysis.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 1,647,051.00
Funding Partners: 1. Funded Budget: 1,048,615 USD 2. Unfunded Budget: 598,436 USD - UNDP Regular $250,000 - UNDP BRC/MDG (pooled) $30,000 - UN Women (pooled) $313,615 - UNFPA (parallel) $106,000 - UNICEF (parallel) $327,000 - ILO (parallel) 22,000 - Romanian Gov (pooled for 2013) 237,900
Implementing partners (both central and local): National Bureau of Statistics, Ministry of Economy, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Labour, Social Protection and Family, Ministry of Internal Affairs, other ministries, UNFPA, UN Women, UNICEF, academia, civil society.

Country: Moldova
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Moldova Aid Effectiveness
Project starting date: March, 2012
Project ending data: December, 2013
Visit project website:
Brief description : The overall objectives of the project is to support the implementation of Moldova’s National Development Strategy and sector development programs as well as cross-cutting programs by improving the effectiveness of aid through Improved ownership, alignment, harmonization, management for results and mutual accountability. It is further the objective to improve communication of development results and information about aid. This is expected to be achieved through support to the PPIP implementation and monitoring and through the promotion and support to development of program based approaches as frames for managing aid, specific sector based and program based aid improvement plans and through support to sectors to develop and improve their communication of program based policies and strategies and of outcomes and results.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 250,000.00
Funding Partners: UNDP
Implementing partners (both central and local): State Chancellary
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Chisinau
Number of beneficiaries: N/A
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Ministry of Finance, CSO
Contact person : Alexandru Oprunenco, Policy Specialist/Programme Manager Email: registry.md@undp.org www.undp.md Tel: + (373 22) 269 202 Fax: +(373 22) 22 00 41
Country: Moldova
Download Project Document :
Project Name : Mainstreaming Migration in National Development Strategies: “Joint Pilot Programme Mainstreaming of Migration into Development in Moldova (MOMID)”
Project starting date: June, 2012
Project ending data: September, 2013
Visit project website:
Brief description : This project supports the objective of the Government of the Republic of Moldova (GoM) to integrate its migration and development agendas and develop national policies on international migration and development for implementation by the relevant government agencies, private sector and non-governmental organizations. Moldova has been selected as one of the pilot countries for this project in light of the developments made by the GoM to undertake this initiative thus far and the demonstrated wish to more systematically mainstream migration in its development planning to maximize the benefits of migration and minimize the negative impacts of migration on economic and human development. The support from the Global Migration Group (GMG) is geared towards mainstreaming international migration into the National Development Strategy and afferent policy documents through coherent action with the support of the UN Country Team in Moldova.
Thematic area : Poverty Reduction
Icon name: small_yellow
Total budget (USD): 150,000.00
Funding Partners: SDC
Implementing partners (both central and local): State Chancellary
Number of project staff : 1
Name of the location (region/district, village): Chisinau
Number of beneficiaries:
Name of beneficiaries or organization : Line ministries and agencies, UNCT, CSOs/Think-Tanks and Diaspora Associations, Academia, etc.
Contact person : Alexandru Oprunenco, Policy Specialist/Programme Manager Email: registry.md@undp.org www.undp.md Tel: + (373 22) 269 202 Fax: +(373 22) 22 00 41
Country: Moldova
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.md/projects/prodoc/2010/JILDP_Adjusted%20Programme_Document_final.pdf
Project Name : Joint Integrated Local Development Programme
Project starting date: 2009
Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.md/projects/JILDP.shtml
Brief description : The project assists the Government of the Republic of Moldova in the process of decentralization and strengthening of the local self-government.The program is implemented in terms of the human rights based approach and gender equality and, therefore, appeal to a wider participation, accountability, transparency and nondiscrimination in all national and local development processes. To assist the Government of the Republic of Moldova to upgrade national legal, policy and advisory frameworks to support sustainable processes of development at sub-national level.To develop capacity of local authorities for rights based and gender responsive planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of development initiatives. To empower rural communities and CSOs in target regions to actively participate in local development planning, implementation and monitoring and have better access to improved service delivery and community infrastructure.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 5,780,711.00
Funding Partners: Swedish Government, UN Women and UNDP.
Implementing partners (both central and local): Central and local public authorities, civil society, academia and scientific organizations, international organizations. 
Number of project staff : 8
Name of the location (region/district, village): Călmăţui, Hancesti
Number of beneficiaries: 251
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Valeria Ieseanu, Programme Analyst Email: registry.md@undp.org www.undp.md Tel: + (373 22) 26 91 18 Fax: +(373 22) 22 00 41
Country: Moldova

Visit project website: http://www.undp.md/projects/JILDP.shtml
Brief description : The project assists the Government of the Republic of Moldova in the process of decentralization and strengthening of the local self-government.The program is implemented in terms of the human rights based approach and gender equality and, therefore, appeal to a wider participation, accountability, transparency and nondiscrimination in all national and local development processes. To assist the Government of the Republic of Moldova to upgrade national legal, policy and advisory frameworks to support sustainable processes of development at sub-national level.To develop capacity of local authorities for rights based and gender responsive planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of development initiatives. To empower rural communities and CSOs in target regions to actively participate in local development planning, implementation and monitoring and have better access to improved service delivery and community infrastructure.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 5,780,711.00
Funding Partners: Swedish Government, UN Women and UNDP.
Implementing partners (both central and local): Central and local public authorities, civil society, academia and scientific organizations, international organizations. 
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Tartaul, Cantemir
Number of beneficiaries: 2,023
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Valeria Ieseanu, Programme Analyst Email: registry.md@undp.org www.undp.md Tel: + (373 22) 26 91 18 Fax: +(373 22) 22 00 41
Country: Moldova
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.md/projects/prodoc/2010/JILDP_Adjusted%20Programme_Document_final.pdf

Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.md/projects/JILDP.shtml
Brief description : The project assists the Government of the Republic of Moldova in the process of decentralization and strengthening of the local self-government.The program is implemented in terms of the human rights based approach and gender equality and, therefore, appeal to a wider participation, accountability, transparency and nondiscrimination in all national and local development processes. To assist the Government of the Republic of Moldova to upgrade national legal, policy and advisory frameworks to support sustainable processes of development at sub-national level.To develop capacity of local authorities for rights based and gender responsive planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of development initiatives. To empower rural communities and CSOs in target regions to actively participate in local development planning, implementation and monitoring and have better access to improved service delivery and community infrastructure.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 5,780,711.00
Funding Partners: Swedish Government, UN Women and UNDP.
Implementing partners (both central and local): Central and local public authorities, civil society, academia and scientific organizations, international organizations. 
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Hincauti, Edinet
Number of beneficiaries: 69
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Valeria Ieseanu, Programme Analyst Email: registry.md@undp.org www.undp.md Tel: + (373 22) 26 91 18 Fax: +(373 22) 22 00 41
Country: Moldova
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.md/projects/prodoc/2010/JILDP_Adjusted%20Programme_Document_final.pdf

Project ending data: 2012
Visit project website: http://www.undp.md/projects/JILDP.shtml
Brief description : The project assists the Government of the Republic of Moldova in the process of decentralization and strengthening of the local self-government.The program is implemented in terms of the human rights based approach and gender equality and, therefore, appeal to a wider participation, accountability, transparency and nondiscrimination in all national and local development processes. To assist the Government of the Republic of Moldova to upgrade national legal, policy and advisory frameworks to support sustainable processes of development at sub-national level.To develop capacity of local authorities for rights based and gender responsive planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of development initiatives. To empower rural communities and CSOs in target regions to actively participate in local development planning, implementation and monitoring and have better access to improved service delivery and community infrastructure.
Thematic area : Democratic Governance
Icon name: small_red
Total budget (USD): 5,780,711.00
Funding Partners: Swedish Government, UN Women and UNDP.
Implementing partners (both central and local): Central and local public authorities, civil society, academia and scientific organizations, international organizations. 
Number of project staff :
Name of the location (region/district, village): Antonesti, Stefan-Voda
Number of beneficiaries: 80
Name of beneficiaries or organization :
Contact person : Valeria Ieseanu, Programme Analyst Email: registry.md@undp.org www.undp.md Tel: + (373 22) 26 91 18 Fax: +(373 22) 22 00 41
Country: Moldova
Download Project Document : http://www.undp.md/projects/prodoc/2010/JILDP_Adjusted%20Programme_Document_final.pdf
